 div:
  h1 : NOVA Accounting 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : The NOVA Account module provides client accounting facilities to support the various financial transactions generated within the NOVA system.  It includes management accounting functionality and provides an export facility for transferring account balances (according to user-defined consolidation rules) to  other general ledger systems. 
  div:
   div:
    h2 : Features 
    span : Multi-Currency / Transaction & Value Date Accounting 
    span : Cross-Company and Cross-Currency transactions 
    span : User-defined transaction posting rules, Accounting Periods and Account groups 
    span : Real-Time Account Balance and Transaction Enquiries 
    span : Journals 
   div:
    span : Periodic and ad-hoc report generation 
    span : Double entry accounting for Stock & Cash 
    span : Supports both File and Real-time API adaptors 
    span : Periodic Statement Production in User-Defined Statement Format 
  h2 : Benefits 
  div:
   span : Streamlined and straight-through accounting reporting 
   span : Complete integrity and control over accounting records 
   span : Flexible reporting to meet local requirements 
   span : Real-time visibility of critical data including balances and positions 
   span : Improved substantiation to meet internal and regulatory audits 
  span : Contact Us for More Details 
 footer:

   p : A smart and professional solution for all traders.

 div:
  h1 : Automate Complete Margin & Collateral Management Workflow 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Initial Margin Requirements & Calculations 
     p : Define your own limits based on business tolerance. System auto generates flags for margin calls; auto adjustment of price for valuations; allows configuring trading limits/available funds setup. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Risk Management & Regulatory Compliances 
     p : Maximize efficiency by optimizing counterparty risk exposure, reducing the expenses of funding initial margin and capital requirements, all while mitigating systemic risk. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Collateral Management & Portfolio Reconciliation 
     p : Looking for lowest latency connectivity, minimal risk and improve certainty of execution with >99.99% up-time? 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : NOVA Margin is built around an extremely flexible model which has already satisfied the unique requirements of clients in Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore and New Zealand.
This model has been designed to provide functions that allow significant extensions, as described below, without the necessity to modify the underlying NOVA structures and processes. 
  h2 : Structure & Key Features of NOVA Margin 
  div:
   h2 : Features 
   p : Loans Processing 
   p : Auto Adjustment of Price for Valuations 
   p : Configurable Trading Limits/Available Funds Setup 
   p : Consolidated view of Margin Transactions 
   p : Support of User defined Worksheet 
   p : Margin Group Maintainance 
   p : Daily Margin Maintaince 
   p : Weighted Asset Interest Computation 
   p : Flexible Interest/Accrual Calculation 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   div:
    div:
     p : End-to-End STP, which reduces the manual workload 
     p : Flexible Real-time API available for upstream and downstream system 
     p : Full audit trail of transaction workflows 
    div:
     p : Ability to define and auto calculate Asset based interest processing 
     p : In-built reports on summarised Margin data & Client Defined Static Data 
     p : Rule based Margin call calculation 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : Generate Comprehensive Reports & Ensure Consistent Data Synchronization Across All Counterparties & Accounts 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : NOVA Report is a Financial Information Reporting system that provides automatic generation of regulatory reports from data on the NOVA database as well as other sources. It retains imported data in a data repository, and populates the relevant reports using that data. These reports are generally scheduled to run automatically using an administrative tool, but can be run manually – for example to print a historic report. NOVA provides a standard report pack for each major market. 
  div:
   h2 : Features 
   div:
    div:
     div : Data Repository 
     div : Date Tables 
     div : Report Server 
     div : ReportXchange Server 
     div : ReportXchange Admin 
    div:
     div : Data Repository 
     p : A central repository to hold all imported data from all selected major markets. 
     div : Date Tables 
     p : Holding details of global static data (such as company name, chairman’s name), and report specific static data (such as, person responsible for a report, person’s telephone number). 
     div : Report Server 
     p : A set of stored procedures that are used to insert and extract data from the database. 
     div : ReportXchange Server 
     p : An NT service that manages scheduling of data import to the system and automatic printing of the reports based on set schedules. 
     div : ReportXchange Admin 
     p : A client program that has two main functions including set up and maintenance of report profiles, details of report scheduling, etc.; and manual viewing, or printing of reports on an ad-hoc basis. 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   div:
    div:
     span : Consolidate 
     p : Utilize NOVA to access aggregated and standardized clearing data instead of dealing with various counterparty credentials and formats. 
    div:
     span : Generate Actionable Reports 
     p : Create customised repots on various activities including trading activities, positions, profit & loss, turnover, and more. 
    div:
     span : Risk Analysis 
     p : Gain insights to understand your risks better and quicker. Estimate the impact of large future changes on the value of portfolios or single positions. 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : Automate All Corporate Actions Events, Enabling Prompt Response & Compliance 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : A multi-market, multi-currency corporate action engine, NOVA Corporate Actions provides processing continuity for corporate events occurring in both domestic and international markets. The inherent flexibility of the platform to create user definable corporate action types and workflow significantly increases STP levels of corporate action processing regardless of the market or corporate action type. The NOVA Corporate Actions can be deployed as a complimentary solution with other NOVA modules like NOVA's Exception Queue Monitor, to provide a seamless platform or as a standalone solution. 
  h2 : Corporate Actions 
  div:
   h2 : Key Benefits 
   p : User definable corporate action structure allows for configuration changes rather than development changes; this significantly increases efficiency with a quicker time to market. 
   p : Increased operational efficiency via a centralised corporate action processing engine with extensive integration points. 
   p : Can be implemented as a stand-alone global / regional / country-specific solution depending on your business requirements. 
  div:
   h2 : Key Features 
   div:
    div:
     p : Ability to interface into multiple data vendors for downloading of Corporate Action announcements 
     p : Creation of the corporate action event with the ability to support multiple options 
     p : User defined multi-currency handling charges 
     p : Full reverse / redo functionality 
    div:
     p : Ability to define Client currency and option preferences 
     p : Ability to define unique client documentation: entitlement notices, credit & debit advices 
     p : Comprehensive functionality supporting Custody, Claim and Principal Processing Entitlement override and excess entitlement processing with exception alert 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : NOVA Stock Borrowing & Lending 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : Stock lending and borrowing, also known as securities lending, is a financial mechanism where you allow another party—typically a financial institution—to temporarily borrow stocks that you already own. In return, you receive a fee for this arrangement. Think of it as “renting” out your stocks for institutions or other parties to use.

NOVA Stock Borrowing & Lending module supports the broker in lending their own stock and borrowing stock to support their market making operation or to reduce failed settlement. Stock Loan transactions are entered as stand-alone transactions with only Principal trades – between an internal, house book and the market, being supported. The SWIFT messaging for reporting SBL transactions for settlement is highly automated with the settlement revaluation and return all being processed on the back of messages received from Stock exchanges (e.g.: Euroclear UK & Ireland system, CREST). 
  h2 : Features 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   p : End-to-End STP to reduce manual workload 
   p : Real-time APIs to automate SBL processing 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details 
 footer:
  div:
   p : A smart and professional solution for all traders. 
   div:
    h5 : Contact Info 
    span : 120 Robinson Road, #15-01, Singapore 068913 
    span : Singapore 
    span : info@contemi.com 
    span : +65 6340 1027 
   div:
    h5 : Quick Links 
    p:
     a : Home (https://nova.contemi.com/)
     a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/articles/)
     a : Insights (https://nova.contemi.com/blog/)
     a : About Us (https://nova.contemi.com/about-us/)
     a : Contact Us (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
  a : Nova Post Trade (https://nova.contemi.com/)

 div:
  h1 : A Unified Platform Providing Seamless Low-Touch Processing from Post-Trade Execution to Settlement Confirmation 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Global Regulatory Compliances 
     p : Diverse regulatory frameworks, multiple markets messaging formats, currencies and asset classes; NOVA supports it all. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Transparency and Data Security 
     p : Multi-tier architecture of NOVA enables controlled access to data to safeguard sensitive and valuable information. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Client-Centricity and Empowermen 
     p : NOVA provides instant access to end-client information, and empowers clients with self-service capabilities. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
  p : Amidst increasingly intricate trading landscape marked by cost constraints and regulatory hurdles, there's an urgent need to quickly adopt post-trade automation solutions to reduce expenses and streamline processes. With NOVA Post Trade+, brokers have the opportunity to enhance efficiency and achieve cost savings by optimizing their utilization of current investments and adhering to suggested best practices, both for themselves and their clients. 
  div:
   h2 : Seize Command of Your Business Operations While Empowering Your Customers to Govern Their Own 
   div:
    div:
     div : Everything You Need in One System 
     div : Improved Operational Efficiency 
     div : Empower Your Customers 
    div:
     div : Everything You Need in One System 
     p : “NOVA post-trade technology is a comprehensive capital markets solution that includes middle and back office processing, clearing, and settlement. NOVA facilitates complete automation of the post-trade lifecycle, enabling low-touch processing from trade agreement through to settlement finality. “ 
     div : Improved Operational Efficiency 
     p : With NOVA, brokers can streamline their workflows and integrate technology to simplify processes, greatly reduce transaction failures, and avoid regulatory penalties. It supports multiple asset clasees, currencies, and settlement connections, enabling brokers to centralize their global settlements and back-office operations within a single platform. 
     div : Empower Your Customers 
     p : Brokers can connect with their global client base, including extending services to existing clients who currently manage manual processes. The browser-based UI od NOVA platform allows users to access the application from web browsers, as well as mobile devices. Multi-layered architecture reduces exposure of sensitive data to the client-side. 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  h2 : Friends We've Made 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h3 : Privacy and Cookies Policy 
  div:
   div:
    h5 : 1. INTRODUCTION 
    p : Contemi Solutions and its subsidiaries are committed to protecting personal data and respecting your privacy. 
    p : This privacy statement describes how we collect, use, share, protect, and otherwise process personal information about you. This statement applies to personal information that you provide to us: 
    ul:
     li : as a visitor to our websites or as a user of our client portals; 
     li : when you send us personal information in connection with an inquiry about Contemi providing products and services directly to you; 
     li : as a visitor to our premises; and 
     li : as a contact at one of our clients, potential clients, suppliers or other business partners. 
    strong : Notice to Customers of Contemi Clients 
   div:
    h5 : 2. WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT FROM YOU? 
    p : We may collect and process the following information (personal data) about you: 
    ul:
     ul:
      li : This includes information about you that you give to us by filling in forms on our website (or other forms that we ask you to complete), giving us a business card (or similar), or corresponding with us by telephone, post, email or other means. 
      li : It may include, for example, your name, address, email address, work telephone number, mobile telephone number, information about your business relationship with us, information about you necessary to complete anti-money laundering checks in order to comply with requirements relating to anti-money laundering and other legislation applicable to us; and information about your professional role, background and interests. 
     ul:
      li : If you visit our website it will automatically collect certain information about you and your visit, including the Internet protocol (IP) address used to connect your device to the Internet and other information such as your browser type and version. We may also collect information about the pages on our site that you visit. Our website may also download “cookies” to your device – this is described in our separate cookie policy below. 
      li : If you email, telephone, write, or exchange other electronic communications with our employees and other staff members, our information technology systems will record details of those conversations and exchanges, sometimes including their content. 
      li : Some of our premises have closed circuit TV systems which may record you if you visit our premises, for security and safety purposes. 
     ul:
      li : If we have a business relationship with the organisation that you represent, your colleagues or other business contacts may give us information about you, such as your contact details or details of your role in the organisation that you represent. 
      li : We sometimes collect information from other third parties, which can include third party data providers, or from publicly available sources for anti-money-laundering, background checking and similar purposes, to protect our business and to comply with our legal and regulatory obligations. 
   div:
    h5 : 3. EMBEDDED CONTENT 
    p : Pages on this site may include embedded content, like YouTube videos, for example. Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if you visited the other website. 
    p : These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged-in to that website. Below you can find a list of the services we use: 
    h6 : FACEBOOK 
    a : Facebook Privacy Policy (https://www.facebook.com/privacy/)
    h6 : TWITTER 
    a : Twitter Privacy Policy (https://twitter.com/privacy)
    h6 : YOUTUBE 
    a : YouTube Privacy Policy (https://www.youtube.com/static?template=privacy_guidelines)
   div:
    div:
     h5 : 4. COOKIES 
     p : This site uses cookies – small text files that are placed on your machine to help the site provide a better user experience. In general, cookies are used to retain user preferences, store information for things like shopping carts, and provide anonymized tracking data to third party applications like Google Analytics. Cookies generally exist to make your browsing experience better. However, you may prefer to disable cookies on this site and on others. The most effective way to do this is to disable cookies in your browser. We suggest consulting the help section of your browser. 
     h6 : NECESSARY COOKIES (ALL SITE VISITORS) 
     ul:
      li:
       b : cfduid: 
       a : CloudFlare Privacy Policy (https://www.cloudflare.com/privacypolicy/)
      b : PHPSESSID: 
     h6 : NECESSARY COOKIES (ADDITIONAL FOR LOGGED IN CUSTOMERS) 
     ul:
      b : wp-auth: 
      b : wordpress_logged_in_{hash}: 
      b : wordpress_test_cookie 
      b : wp-settings-[UID]: 
      b : wp-settings-[UID]: 
    span : 5. WHO HAS ACCESS TO YOUR DATA 
   div:
    p : If you are not a registered client for our site, there is no personal information we can retain or view regarding yourself. 
    p : If you are a client with a registered account, your personal information can be accessed by: 
    ul:
     li : Our system administrators. 
     li : Our supporters when they (in order to provide support) need to get the information about the client accounts and access. 
   div:
    h5 : 6. HOW WILL WE USE YOUR INFORMATION?

chunk-003e21c3fc7123bac1926ec723ec006c.content:
are not a registered client for our site, there is no personal information we can retain or view regarding yourself. 
    p : If you are a client with a registered account, your personal information can be accessed by: 
    ul:
     li : Our system administrators. 
     li : Our supporters when they (in order to provide support) need to get the information about the client accounts and access. 
   div:
    h5 : 6. HOW WILL WE USE YOUR INFORMATION? 
    p : We may use your information for the following purposes: 
    ul:
     li : to personalise and customise your experience with us; conduct research and analysis; and fulfil orders and requests for products, services, or information from you or the organization that you represent. 
     li : to send you marketing communications regarding our products and services. 
     li : for ordinary business purposes, including to operate and administer the products and services provided by Contemi Solutions in accordance with the terms of any agreements that we may have with our clients. 
     li : to operate, administer and improve our website and premises and other aspects of the way in which we conduct our operations. 
     li : to protect our business from fraud, money-laundering, breach of confidence, theft of proprietary materials and other financial or business crimes. 
     li : to comply with our legal and regulatory obligations, and to bring and defend legal claims where the information is pertinent (including to allow us to pursue available remedies or limit the damages that we may sustain). 
     li : to comply with our internal policies and maintain our records or as otherwise required by applicable data protection laws. 
     li : to respond to requests from our clients that are not already addressed above. 
    p : We may from time to time be required to review information about you held in our systems – including the contents of and other information related to your email and other communications with us – for compliance and business-protection purposes as described above. 
    p : This may include reviews for the purposes of disclosure of information relevant to litigation and/or reviews of records relevant to internal or external regulatory or criminal investigations. 
    p : To the extent permitted by applicable law, these reviews will be conducted in a reasonable and proportionate way, and approved at an appropriate level of management. They may ultimately involve disclosure of your information to governmental agencies and litigation counterparties as set out below. 
    p : Your emails and other communications may also be accessed occasionally by persons other than the member of staff with whom they are exchanged for ordinary business management purposes (for example, where necessary when a staff member is out of the office or has left our organisation). 
    p : We will only process your personal information as necessary to pursue the purposes described above. 
    p : In exceptional circumstances, we may also be required by law to disclose or otherwise process your personal information. 
    p : We will tell you, when we ask you to provide information about yourself, if: 
    ul:
     li : provision of the requested information is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation, or 
     li : it is purely voluntary and there will be no implications if you decline to provide the information. 
    a : info@contemi.com (mailto:info@contemi.com)
   div:
    h5 : 7. HOW LONG WE RETAIN YOUR DATA 
    p : When you submit a support ticket or a comment, its metadata is retained until (if) you tell us to remove it. We use this data so that we can recognize you and approve your comments automatically instead of holding them for moderation. 
    p : If you register on our website, we also store the personal information you provide in your user profile. You can see, edit, or delete your personal information at any time (except changing your username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information. 
   div:
    h5 : 8. SECURITY MEASURES 
    p : We use the SSL/HTTPS protocol throughout our site. This encrypts our user communications with the servers so that personal identifiable information is not captured/hijacked by third parties without authorization. 
    p : In case of a data breach, system administrators will immediately take all needed steps to ensure system integrity, will contact affected users and will attempt to reset passwords if needed. 
   span : 9. YOUR DATA RIGHTS 
   div:
    h6 : GENERAL RIGHTS 
    p : If you have a registered account on this website or have left comments, you can request an exported file of the personal data we retain, including any additional data you have provided to us. 
    p : You can also request that we erase any of the personal data we have stored. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes. In short, we cannot erase data that is vital to you being an active customer (i.e. basic account information like an email address). 
    p : If you wish that all of your data is erased, we will no longer be able to offer any support or other product-related services to you. 
    h6 : GDPR RIGHTS 
    a : EU GDPR Information Portal. (https://www.eugdpr.org/)
   span : 10. RELEASE OF YOUR DATA FOR LEGAL PURPOSES 
   div:
    p : At times it may become necessary or desirable to Contemi, for legal purposes, to release your information in response to a request from a government agency or a private litigant. You agree that we may disclose your information to a third party where we believe, in good faith, that it is desirable to do so for the purposes of a civil action, criminal investigation, or other legal matter. In the event that we receive a subpoena affecting your privacy, we may elect to notify you to give you an opportunity to file

chunk-77f5e639f3ba2987c82996397962e155.content:
may become necessary or desirable to Contemi, for legal purposes, to release your information in response to a request from a government agency or a private litigant. You agree that we may disclose your information to a third party where we believe, in good faith, that it is desirable to do so for the purposes of a civil action, criminal investigation, or other legal matter. In the event that we receive a subpoena affecting your privacy, we may elect to notify you to give you an opportunity to file a motion to quash the subpoena, or we may attempt to quash it ourselves, but we are not obligated to do either. We may also proactively report you, and release your information to, third parties where we believe that it is prudent to do so for legal reasons, such as our belief that you have engaged in fraudulent activities. You release us from any damages that may arise from or relate to the release of your information to a request from law enforcement agencies or private litigants. 
    p : Any passing on of personal data for legal purposes will only be done in compliance with laws of the country you reside in. 
   div:
    h5 : 11. DISCLOSURE AND INTERNATIONAL TRANSFER OF YOUR INFORMATION 
    p : We may disclose personal information about you, in accordance with the various legitimate purposes set out above: 
    ul:
     li : to the other legal entities within Contemi Solutions. 
     li : if we receive the personal information from you as a representative of one of our business partners or clients, to your colleagues within the organisation that you represent. 
     li : to third party service providers who host our website or other information technology systems or otherwise hold or process your information on our behalf, under substantially similar conditions of confidentiality and security. 
     li : business partners, suppliers and sub-contractors for the performance of any contract we enter into with them or you. 
     li : in connection with a proposed or actual sale, merger, transfer, or exchange of all or a portion of a business or operating unit; in accordance with our legal obligations, including to competent regulatory, prosecuting and other governmental agencies, or litigation counterparties, in any country or territory or where we are otherwise required by law to disclose. 
    p : These disclosures may involve transferring your personal information overseas. If you are dealing with us within the European Economic Area (or the UK, after it has left the European Economic Area), you should be aware that this may include transfers to countries outside the European Economic Area / UK, which do not have similarly strict data privacy laws and which may therefore afford a lower standard of personal data protection. In those cases, where we transfer personal data to other legal entities within Contemi or our service providers, we will ensure that our arrangements with them are governed by data transfer agreements, designed to ensure that your personal information is protected, on terms approved for this purpose by the European Commission. 
    h5 : HOW WE KEEP YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION SAFE? 
    p : We are committed to protecting your personal information submitted to us. We maintain an information security program including internal policies addressing the acceptable use and access to confidential business information and personal information which may be contained within Contemi’s information systems. We maintain physical, electronic and procedural safeguards reasonably designed to guard personal information from loss, misuse or unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration or destruction of the information that has been provided to us through our on-line services. 
    h5 : CONTACT US 
    a : info@contemi.com (mailto:info@contemi.com)
    a : info@contemi.com (mailto:info@contemi.com)
    p : We will respond to your request consistent with applicable data protection laws. Depending upon the type of business relationship that you have with us, we may need to notify you that additional information is necessary to authenticate your identity for your data security or that we will refer your inquiry to the financial services entity that holds the primary relationship with you. 
    p : For requests to delete your personal information as permitted under applicable data protection laws, we will work with you to accomplish your requests unless otherwise exempted under applicable data protection laws, such as compliance with applicable law or regulatory inquiry. 
    h5 : CHANGES TO THIS POLICY 
    p : Any changes we make to this privacy policy in the future will be posted to our website. Please check back frequently to see any changes.

  div:
   h1 : Meet the Team 
   h2 : Executive Team 
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Gopala Subramanium 
     p : CEO – Capital Market Solutions & Group CFO 
    p : Gopala Subramanium, CEO of Capital Market Solutions and Group CFO at Contemi Solutions, is a finance industry veteran with over 20 years of experience, specializing in turning businesses into profit powerhouses through aggressive revenue growth, cost optimization, and high-margin strategies. From orchestrating the record-breaking Religare IPO to steering Contemi’s financial and operational strategies, his journey from Jamshedpur to Singapore showcases a global, strategic mindset. An EMBA from S.P. Jain School and a member of the Singapore Institute of Directors, Gopala’s leadership transcends financial acumen, embodying innovation, ethical growth, and stakeholder engagement. His commitment to mentoring and community service, combined with his knack for profitable business transformation, makes him a pivotal figure in team’s success. 
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Gaurav Mehta 
     p : Chief Commercial Officer 
    p : Gaurav Mehta is a seasoned professional with a robust track record spanning financial services, technology, and media sectors. With expertise in business development, digital strategy, marketing management, negotiation, business planning, and sales, Gaurav excels in driving growth and innovation. Armed with a Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.) specializing in Strategy, Finance, and Marketing from prestigious institutions such as The University of Hong Kong and London Business School, he brings a strategic and analytical approach to every project. Gaurav’s ability to navigate complex landscapes and his knack for identifying and capitalizing on emerging opportunities make him a valuable asset to any organization. With a passion for driving results and a commitment to excellence, Gaurav is poised to make a significant impact in the ever-evolving business landscape.

     p : With 25 years of Stock Broking solutions implementations and services delivery experience, Kenneth has successfully brought a few Stock Broking Back Office implementation projects to production among his past achievements.

 div:
  div:
   div : Kshitiswar Tripathy 
   div : Head Of Product – Post Trade 
   div:
    p:
     strong : Professional 
     span : : 
    span : A Financial Technology oriented individual with over 19+ years of strong experience in software analysis, design, development, customization, and implementation of Post Trade Products globally. Accomplished product management executive with more than a decade of experience driving the development and execution of successful product strategies. A strategic thinker with strong focus on user experience and a passion of leveraging technology to solve complex challenges. Possessing in-depth knowledge of the Capital Markets and it’s business by being a key contributor in the projects with leading customers. Blend technology skills with extensive Agile/Scrum experience, a marketing orientation, and analytical abilities to evolve product strategy. 
    strong : Personal: 
    span : Personally, I love spending time with my family and given a break from work, I pack my bags and get on an adventurous trip to a new country with my family by my side. My 12 year old is less a son and more a friend to me, and most of the time I am around him. Typically, my favourite evening would be watching a cricket match (even the most boring one) with my friends and a free flow of drinks & food! 
  span : Powered by (https://www.essentialplugin.com?utm_source=https://nova.contemi.com&utm_medium=popup&utm_campaign=credit-link)
 div:
  div:
   div : Manuj Bhardwaj 
   div : Head of Engineering 
   br : Prior roles in his professional journey helped him to hone his skills in project management, stakeholder engagement, and technical leadership. In his personal time, Manuj enjoys spending time outdoors, playing sports, and exploring new trails. Additionally, he finds relaxation in cooking and experimenting with new recipes, often hosting gatherings with friends and family to share meals and laughter. 
  span : Powered by (https://www.essentialplugin.com?utm_source=https://nova.contemi.com&utm_medium=popup&utm_campaign=credit-link)
 div:
  div:
   div : Paul Garnham 
   div : System Architect 
   div:
    span : Paul is our System Architect based in Melbourne and leads Systems Analysis and Design in the Contemi Post Trade domain. Paul draws on his 38 years experience in the design and development of applications in the Post Trade environment. In addition to systems development he has extensive business knowledge across many markets and with Post Trade processing. 
    span : Outside of work, Paul enjoys family life and coaches American football. He has coached at International and domestic representative level as well as with his very successful local team. 
  span : Powered by (https://www.essentialplugin.com?utm_source=https://nova.contemi.com&utm_medium=popup&utm_campaign=credit-link)
 div:
  div:
   div : Sarjerao Shinde 
   div : Operations Manager 
   div:
    p : Sarjerao, an Operations Manager based in Singapore, brings over 17 years of extensive experience in the trading industry, with a strong foundation in software engineering. Currently, he oversees IT Operations and Professional Services for customers in Singapore, playing a crucial role in maintaining and enhancing service delivery. 
    p : Sarjerao has been instrumental in spearheading significant initiatives, including a pivotal role in the Singapore Exchange’s (SGX) project to replace the Trading Member’s Post Trade Management System with a new, cutting-edge API-based Customer Accounting System. This initiative has not only improved operational efficiencies but also enhanced the technological framework to meet modern trading demands. 
  span : Powered by (https://www.essentialplugin.com?utm_source=https://nova.contemi.com&utm_medium=popup&utm_campaign=credit-link)

    p : Laurence So, is an accomplished professional with over 17 years of experience in the Hong Kong financial industry. Based in Hong Kong, he has had the privilege of being part of one of Asia’s leading financial hubs. Throughout his career, he has honed his skills in technical expertise, project management, and business analysis. 
    p : With a strong technical background, he brings a deep understanding of coding, data analysis, and software development to the table. This proficiency allows him to navigate the intricacies of the modern financial landscape with ease. As a seasoned project manager, he has successfully overseen numerous initiatives, ensuring their seamless execution within strict timelines and budgetary constraints.

 div:
  h1 : The Next Frontier in Digital Transformation – Revolutionise Post-Trade Operations in Digital Assets with NOVA 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Settlement Speed 
     p : Traditional post-trade processes involve multiple intermediaries and may take days to settle. Digital assets, supported by blockchain and distributed ledger technology (DLT), enable near-instant settlement, significantly shortening the typical T+2 or T+1 settlement periods. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Reconciliation Efficiency 
     p : Digital assets allow for real-time transaction verification, eliminating the need for complex reconciliation processes between different parties. This reduces manual labour and the risk of discrepancies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Operational Risks 
     p : The shift from conventional processes to those involving digital assets introduces new risks, including technology failures, regulatory challenges, and cybersecurity threats. Ensuring that systems can handle digital asset transactions seamlessly is critical. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : Digital assets have rapidly gained prominence in capital markets, offering new opportunities and challenges. By embracing automation in post-trade processes, financial institutions can manage the complexities associated with digital assets more effectively, ensuring scalability, efficiency, and reduced operational risks. Solutions like those provided by NOVA's post-trade automation platform are positioned to support this evolving landscape by integrating automated processes that meet the demands of the digital asset era.
Blockchain technology and asset digitization have the potential to upend nearly every aspect of traditional financial services. The oncoming digital asset landscape will displace at least some intermediaries and service providers while creating lucrative new opportunities for others. 
  div:
   div:
    h2 : Benefits 
    div:
     span : Lowering Entry Barriers 
     p : By digitizing assets the process becomes more streamlined and efficient by reducing paperwork, quicker verification processes, and the ability to divide large assets into smaller, more manageable digital tokens. 
    div:
     span : Operational Efficiency 
     p : DLT can streamline processes by providing a single source of truth that is accessible to all parties involved. This reduces the need for reconciliation between different records, which is both time-consuming and costly. 
    div:
     span : Global Participation 
     p : Digital assets are not bound by geographical limitations, enabling global participation. This opens up opportunities for a diverse range of investors from different regions to engage in the markets. 
   div:
    div:
     span : Automation & Transparency 
     p : Many digital asset platforms utilise smart contracts, which significantly reduce the complexity of contractual agreements and the execution of transactions. Blockchain, the underlying technology, provides a transparent and immutable ledger that ensures all parties have access to the same information, thereby simplifying auditing and compliance processes. 
    div:
     span : Increased Liquidity 
     p : The increased liquidity is beneficial for both investors looking to exit their positions and for those seeking to enter the market. 
    div:
     span : Reduction in Intermediary Costs 
     p : DLT allows for peer-to-peer transactions without the need for intermediaries, which can significantly reduce transaction fees and other associated costs. 
  div:
   h2 : Key Features 
   div:
    span : Real-Time Settlement and Clearing 
    p : With NOVA Digital Assets, facilitate near real-time settlement and clearing, crucial for the faster-paced nature of digital asset transactions. The system utilises blockchain-based smart contracts to automate settlement processes, reducing counterparty risk. 
    span : Regulatory Compliance and Reporting 
    p : Comply with global and local regulatory requirements by automating data collection and report generation. The system maintains a complete audit trail - a transparent, tamper-proof record of transactions that simplifies audits and meets compliance standards. 
    span : Reconciliation Engine 
    p : NOVA Digital Assets facilitates automated data matching that reconciles transaction records across different ledgers, platforms, and participants to identify and resolve discrepancies. It has a built-in mechanism for managing and addressing exceptions quickly to maintain seamless operations. 
    span : Interoperability and Blockchain Integration 
    p : NOVA Digital Assets has multi-ledger compatibility to interact with different blockchain networks (e.g., Ethereum, Hyperledger) for versatile asset handling. Built with a robust API framework for connecting with legacy systems, trading platforms, and other financial institutions. 
    span : Scalability and High Throughput 
    p : NOVA is built on N-tier architecture that supports high transaction volumes without compromising processing speed or accuracy. Flexible deployment options are available, including secure cloud-based and shared platforms, for scalability and remote access. 
    span : Security and Risk Management 
    p : Advanced encryption ensures secure data transmission and storage to protect against cyber threats. Real-time monitoring helps identify and mitigate risks associated with digital asset transactions. 
    span : End-to-End Workflow Automation 
    p : NOVA Post Trade automates the full process cycle from trade execution to settlement, custody, and reporting, minimizing manual intervention. Customizable workflows allow processes to be configured to cater to specific client needs or regulatory environments. 
    span : User-Friendly Dashboard and Analytics 
    p : NOVA provides real-time monitoring dashboards that give a comprehensive view of transaction statuses, settlement progress, and performance metrics. Advanced data analytics tools provide reporting and visualization for actionable insights and strategic decision-making. 
    span : Workflow Customization and Smart Automation 
    p : Users can set real-time alerts for key trade events, settlement completions, and exceptions. 
    span : Integration with Market Data Providers 
    p : Real-time market data feeds from various

    span : Workflow Customization and Smart Automation 
    p : Users can set real-time alerts for key trade events, settlement completions, and exceptions. 
    span : Integration with Market Data Providers 
    p : Real-time market data feeds from various sources are seamlessly integrated into the system to validate transactions and ensure price accuracy. 
    span : Cross-Asset Support 
    p : Ability to handle transactions involving different types of digital and traditional assets. 
  div:
   p : For a deeper exploration on our Digital Assets solution, speak with our experts – 
   span : Contact Us for More Details

chunk-2763b5770e2359954c3f3c1ab0724413.content:
span : Blogs (https://nova.contemi.com/blogs/)
  span : Contact Us (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-nova-post-trade/)
 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : The Cost of Shortcuts: Understanding Technical Debt in Post-Trade Technology 
       div:
        a : August 13, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/08/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Gaurav Mehta (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gaurav-mehta/)
      div:
       div:
        a : Nova Post Trade (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114)
        a : The Cost of Shortcuts: Understanding Technical Debt in Post-Trade Technology (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114/understanding-technical-debt-in-post-trade-technology)
       div:
        p : In the rapidly evolving world of financial services, technology plays a critical role in ensuring the efficiency, reliability, and scalability of operations. Among the various segments within this industry, the post-trade space is particularly complex, involving the processing of transactions after a trade is executed. However, like any area heavily reliant on technology, the post-trade environment is susceptible to the accumulation of technical debt. This article explores the nature of technical debt in financial services technology, with a focus on the post-trade space, and discusses strategies for managing and mitigating this debt. 
        span : What is Technical Debt? 
        p : Technical debt is a concept borrowed from software development, where it originally described the costs associated with choosing a quick, easy solution over a more robust, sustainable one. In financial services, technical debt refers to the cumulative impact of shortcuts, outdated technologies, and suboptimal practices that can hinder future development, increase costs, and introduce risks. 
        p : While some level of technical debt is inevitable and even strategic in fast-paced environments, allowing it to accumulate unchecked can lead to significant challenges, particularly in the post-trade space where accuracy, speed, and compliance are paramount. 
        span : The Unique Challenges of the Post-Trade Space 
        p : The post-trade process in financial markets includes a series of steps such as trade confirmation, settlement, clearing, and reporting. Each of these steps is crucial for the integrity of the financial system and requires a high level of precision and reliability. The post-trade space is also subject to strict regulatory scrutiny, adding another layer of complexity. 
        p : Several factors contribute to the accumulation of technical debt in this area: 
        ol:
         strong : Legacy Systems 
         strong : Regulatory Changes 
         strong : Market Pressures 
         strong : Complexity and Interdependencies 
        span : The Impact of Technical Debt 
        p : The accumulation of technical debt in the post-trade space can have several adverse effects: 
        strong : Increased Operational Risk 
        strong : Higher Maintenance Costs 
        strong : Reduced Agility 
        strong : Compliance Risks 
        span : Strategies for Managing Technical Debt 
        p : Effectively managing technical debt requires a proactive and strategic approach. Here are some strategies that financial institutions can employ: 
        ol:
         strong : Prioritization and Risk Assessment 
         strong : Modernization of Legacy Systems 
         strong : Regular Refactoring 
         strong : Cross-Functional Collaboration 
         strong : Investment in Training and Tools 
        span : Conclusion 
        p : In the highly regulated and complex post-trade space of financial services, managing technical debt is not just a technical challenge but a strategic imperative. Institutions that proactively address technical debt can reduce operational risks, lower costs, and maintain the agility needed to compete in a rapidly changing environment. By understanding the unique challenges of the post-trade space and implementing effective strategies, financial institutions can ensure that their technology infrastructure remains robust, compliant, and ready for the future. 
      span : Share 
     div:
      span : Gaurav Mehta (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gaurav-mehta/)
      p : Chief Commercial Officer

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : Transforming Finance in Asia-Pacific: How Digital Assets and Post-Trade Automation are Shaping the Future 
       div:
        a : November 26, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/11/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Kshitiswar Tripathy (https://nova.contemi.com/author/kshitiswar-tripathy/)
      div:
       div:
        a : Nova Post Trade (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114)
        a : Transforming Finance in Asia-Pacific: How Digital Assets (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114/transforming-finance-in-asia-pacific-how-digital-assets-and-post-trade-automation-are-shaping-the-future)
       div:
        p : In my previous article, I explained the types of digital assets and how their popularity is growing to transform the future of capital markets. In this article, I explain their growing popularity in Asia-Pacific, the regulatory steps taken by different countries, and how automation of post-trade clearing and settlement processes can further support the benefits of this growing revolution. 
        p : The Asia-Pacific (APAC) region is emerging as a powerhouse for digital asset adoption. With its tech-savvy population, innovative financial hubs, and progressive regulatory frameworks, APAC is at the forefront of integrating blockchain technologies and digital assets into mainstream finance. Yet, as the adoption grows, so do the challenges associated with post-trade clearing and settlement. Automation offers a transformative opportunity to address these issues, unlocking the full potential of digital assets in the region. 
        h3 : The Rising Popularity of Digital Assets in Asia-Pacific 
        strong : Tech-Driven Economies 
        p : Countries like Singapore, Japan, South Korea, and Hong Kong are global leaders in fintech innovation. Their robust infrastructure and support for blockchain technology have created thriving ecosystems for digital assets, encompassing cryptocurrencies, tokenized assets, and central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). 
        strong : Evolving Regulatory Landscape 
        p : Governments in APAC are adopting pragmatic approaches to regulate digital assets. For instance: 
        ul:
         li : Singapore has established clear guidelines for digital payment tokens under its Payment Services Act. 
         li : Japan has developed a regulatory framework for security token offerings (STOs) and cryptocurrency exchanges. 
         li : Hong Kong recently allowed licensed virtual asset service providers (VASPs) to serve retail investors, expanding market participation. 
        strong : Institutional Participation 
        p : Leading financial institutions and corporations are diving into digital assets. Companies are exploring tokenized bonds, securities, and real estate, aiming to capitalize on the liquidity, transparency, and efficiency offered by blockchain. 
        strong : Inclusion of Retail Investors 
        p : APAC’s digitally native population is rapidly adopting cryptocurrencies and decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms, further fuelling the growth of digital assets. 
        h3 : Challenges in Post-Trade Clearing and Settlement 
        p : Despite these advancements, the post-trade processes for digital assets remain a bottleneck. Current systems are burdened by: 
        p : Fragmented Ecosystems: Multiple trading venues and custodians operate in silos, complicating the settlement process. 
        p : Counterparty Risks: Decentralized finance and bilateral over-the-counter (OTC) trades expose participants to risks due to the lack of standardized clearing mechanisms. 
        p : Inefficiencies: Legacy systems, designed for traditional assets, cannot accommodate the instantaneous nature of blockchain-based transactions. 
        p : Regulatory Gaps: Cross-border transactions face compliance hurdles, given the lack of globally harmonized standards for digital assets. 
        h3 : The Role of Automation in Post-Trade Processes 
        p : Automation is essential for overcoming these challenges. By leveraging distributed ledger technology (DLT) and smart contracts, post-trade processes can achieve the following: 
        strong : Real-Time Settlement 
        p : Blockchain’s ability to process transactions in real-time (T+0) eliminates delays associated with traditional systems. Automated settlements reduce the need for intermediaries, enabling instant transfer of ownership and funds. 
        strong : Risk Mitigation 
        p : Smart contracts automate the enforcement of transaction terms, ensuring delivery-versus-payment (DvP) and reducing settlement risks. Automation also eliminates manual errors and enhances transaction security. 
        strong : Operational Efficiency 
        p : Automation reduces reliance on manual processes for clearing and reconciliation, significantly lowering operational costs and time. Institutions can allocate resources more efficiently. 
        strong : Scalability for Growing Markets 
        p : Automated systems can seamlessly handle the increasing transaction volumes as more participants enter the digital asset space. 
        strong : Improved Regulatory Compliance 
        p : Automation simplifies reporting and compliance by providing transparent, immutable transaction records. This supports regulators in overseeing digital asset markets effectively. 
        h3 : Benefits of Automated Post-Trade Processes 
        strong : Enhanced Liquidity 
        p : Real-time settlement improves liquidity by reducing the capital tied up during clearing and settlement. This is especially critical for APAC’s vibrant markets, where fast trading cycles are the norm. 
        strong : Cross-Border Collaboration 
        p : Automation bridges the gap between fragmented markets in APAC by enabling interoperable systems, fostering seamless cross-border transactions. 
        strong : Cost Optimization 
        p : Lower operational costs and improved efficiency through automation make digital assets

chunk-d6f2d3d528f8e5aa97f6504198236a08.content:
strong : Enhanced Liquidity 
        p : Real-time settlement improves liquidity by reducing the capital tied up during clearing and settlement. This is especially critical for APAC’s vibrant markets, where fast trading cycles are the norm. 
        strong : Cross-Border Collaboration 
        p : Automation bridges the gap between fragmented markets in APAC by enabling interoperable systems, fostering seamless cross-border transactions. 
        strong : Cost Optimization 
        p : Lower operational costs and improved efficiency through automation make digital assets more attractive for institutional and retail investors. 
        strong : Market Integrity 
        p : Transparency and immutability offered by automated DLT systems enhance trust, reducing disputes and fostering confidence in digital asset markets. 
        h3 : Future Outlook 
        p : The APAC region is poised to lead the global adoption of digital assets, driven by technological innovation, regulatory clarity, and robust financial ecosystems. As automation of post-trade processes becomes more prevalent, it will catalyse the growth of digital assets, enabling financial institutions to unlock unprecedented efficiencies. 
        p : Collaboration between regulators, technology providers, and financial institutions will be crucial to creating a unified, automated post-trade infrastructure that supports the region’s aspirations. 
        p : The growing popularity of digital assets in APAC underscores the need for robust post-trade infrastructure. Automation, powered by DLT, offers a transformative solution to address inefficiencies, reduce risks, and drive market growth. As APAC continues to innovate, the integration of automated systems will not only enhance the region’s competitiveness but also set a global benchmark for the future of digital finance.

 div:
  h1 : Streamline and Automate Real-Time Trade Processing 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : NOVA Trade encompasses features related to the initiation and management of client and market transactions, utilizing both manual input and automated procedures (subject to Stock Exchange regulations). It offers capabilities such as automated computation of all market transactions based on stock exchange actions, comparison of executions against client trades/orders for consistency, customizable contract notes and trade confirmations, and additional functionalities. 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   div:
    span : Trading 
    p : Supports both Agency and Principal
NOVA Trade supports both Agency and Principal trading from the entry of Agency and Principal trade legs to the monitoring and revaluation of Principal positions in the NOVA Book module. 
   div:
    span : Multi-Market, Multi-Currency, Multi-Entity 
    p : From settlement date calculation rules of the region, setting market related processing rules, to option to settle in a different
currencies; NOVA platform handles it all. 
   div:
    span : Auto-Management of Exceptions 
    p : User selected options are provided for the treatment of exceptions encountered through the entry of the party/account as part of the trade. Such exceptions may include an abnormal status; the absence of completed agreements, account appearing on a blacklist, and more 
  div:
   div:
    h2 : Features 
    span : Automatic Upload of Market Executions 
    span : Matching of Executions to Client Trades or Orders 
    span : Pick-List of Unmatched Executions for the Market Side of a Trade 
    span : On Screen Reconciliation of Market Executions & Client Trades/Orders 
    span : One-to-One, One-to-Many and Many-to-Many Trade Matching 
    span : Price Tolerance Verification 
    span : Exchange Rate Tolerance Verification 
    span : Accrued Interest for Fixed Interest 
    span : Entry of Block or Confirmed [Allocated] Trade 
   div:
    span : Futures and Options: Margins 
    span : Speciy Charges by Client or Instrument 
    span : Automatic Generation of Settlement Instructions(SI) 
    span : On Screen Modification of Settlement Instructions 
    span : Trade Confirmations and Contract Notes 
    span : Trade Reports Generations 
    span : Trade Execution Allocations 
    span : FX Trade Booking & Allocation 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : Redefine Custodian Experience With Increased Efficiency & Enhanced User Experience 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Improve Client Experience 
     p : Enhance customer loyalty, trust, and satisfaction and grow market-share by offering access to data through modern digital channels, faster processing, greater visibility through an improved user interface. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Increase Business Profitability 
     p : Improve operational efficiencies with automated workflows, and straight-through processing (stp). Use real-time analytics to optimize operations and cloud-enabled solutions to scale accordingly. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Ensure Regulatory Compliance 
     p : Stay up-to-speed with global regulations on a platform that conforms to ISO standards and is regularly updated to ensure compliance with latest regulatory requirements across different geographies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us/)
  p : By replacing legacy systems with our comprehensive cloud-enabled post trade settlement solution, custodians can reduce operational cost, increase Straight-Through-Processing (STP) rates, and provide an extensive user-experience for their clients while increasing operational efficiencies and focus on key business objectives.
NOVA Custody provides functionality specific to brokers providing custodial services to trading (and non-trading) clients.  This includes automatic position keeping and reporting, calculation of service fees according to flexible rules, periodic production of composite custody statements, automatic adjustments for Corporate Actions (e.g. dividends, bonus issues, and re-constructions). 
  h2 : Features 
  div:
   h5 : Stock Holding Maintenance 
   p : Provides a real time view of all Stock Positions for clients who are defined as being custody clients including separation of Pending and Confirmed Holdings within segregated categories of custody client, firm’s principal and firm’s clearing. Positions are automatically adjusted for Stock Movements generated from various functional modules within the system such as Trade, Settlement, Custody, Corporate Action, Stock Lending and Margin Trading. 
  div:
   h5 : Stock Movement, Stock Account, Stock Projection Enquiry 
   p : Provides a history of movements for subsequent enquiry by Instrument, client and firms; a summary of the global stock position by security; and real time list of Projected Stock Position by instrument and custodian for a user-defined period in the future. 
  div:
   h5 : Stock Transfer and Custodian Transfer 
   p : NOVA provides Stock Transfer functions including Deposit, Withdrawal, Client Transfer, Custodian Transfer, Mass Withdrawal, and Stock Earmarking. These functions allow for the Stock Transaction to be ‘Immediate’ or ‘Pending’ based on customer’s requirement. 
  div:
   h5 : Stock Earmarking 
   p : Allows a whole holding or a portion of a holding to be put on hold for a specific reason ie the stock has been pledged for collateral etc. 
  h5 : Settlement Certificate Processing & Recording 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   p : Ad-Hoc Statement Generation 
   p : Calculation of service fees with flexible calculation rules 
   p : Optional manual holding adjustments 
   p : Real-time holding monitoring 
   p : End-to-End STP to reduce manual workload 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : NOVA Payments 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Complete Solution 
     p : With the complexity and volume of corporate action events increasing, the NOVA Corporate Actions provides a centralised and reconciled view of corporate actions across all markets, asset classes or currencies. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Simple & Flexible 
     p : The platform allows users to define and create corporate action types and workflow instead of depending on development changes, thereby significantly increasing efficiency and enabling faster time to market. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Events Agnostic 
     p : The NOVA platform supports corporate actions from cash dividends, bonus issue, share split, consolidation, interest payment and more 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : NOVA Payments / Cash refers to the actual settling of cash component of any underlying FOP transactions.  A payment method is the means by which a payment is made by the firm to an external party such as a client or market counter party.  NOVA supports multiple payment options, including automatic/manual cheques, sweep (to a clearing account), direct credit (DeskBank) - with files created to be sent to the firm’s bank, group payment for aggregated payments to an intermediary (for multiple client accounts), BACS & CHAPS (UK market only), sub agent global, and other user defined payment methods. User can define the default number of days to clear the payment. 
  div:
   h2 : Benefits 
   div:
    div:
     div : In-built ISO standard bank Interfaces 
     div : Real-time APIs to automate Payment \ Receipts transaction processing 
    div:
     div : In-built ISO standard bank Interfaces 
     p : NOVA supports multiple payment options, including automatic/manual cheques, sweep (to a clearing account), direct credit (DeskBank) – with files created to be sent to the firm’s bank, group payment for aggregated payments to an intermediary (for multiple client accounts), BACS & CHAPS (UK market only), sub agent global, and other user defined payment methods. 
     div : Real-time APIs to automate Payment \ Receipts transaction processing 
     p : The auto-payment process picks up open items in the client’s current account (related to settled contracts, journals, and corporate actions) and generates payments in the form of a cheque or direct credit. The system can be configured to generate separate jobs by currency, market, and client type. The system checks available funds across all payment methods to ensure the account is in a net credit state before making any payments. 
   h2 : Features 
  div:
   span : Payment Methods and Payment Instructions Maintenance 
   span : Bank Maintenance and Transactions Reconciliation 
   div:
    span : Open Item Allocation 
    span : Cheque Printing and Reconciliation 
   div:
    span : Direct Credits Processing 
    span : Payment & Receipts Management 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details

 div:
  h1 : About Us 
  p : Contemi’s modern end-to-end technology solutions help them cost effectively streamline operations, improve agility and harness the power of innovation in the evolving world of cloud and digital platforms. Our expertise covers the complete lifecycle of wealth management, property and casualty insurance, captive insurance and post trade management. Our cutting-edge digital solutions for customer management, benefit & loyalty programs, and mobile apps are being used in various industry sectors. 
  div:
   h3 : Accelerating Digital Transformation in the Financial Services Industry 
   span : Contemi, have been at the forefront of digitisation in the insurance, wealth management, private banking and wider financial services industry for more than 25 years. Throughout this period, we have looked upon our customers as partners, and asked them to help define the direction of our shared journey. And together we have successfully navigated many challenges. 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     span : Improve Operational Efficiency 
     p : with automated Striaght Through Processing and multi tier architecture 
    div:
     span : Reduce Cost 
     p : operate more efficiently, and minimise risk with cloud-hosted infrastructure 
   div:
    div:
     span : Scalable & Future-Ready 
     p : with multi tier architecture enabling load balancing and increased security 
    div:
     span : Lower Security Risks 
     p : multi tier architecture that isolates critical data under several encrypted layers 
   div:
    div:
     span : Strong Clearing & settlement 
     p : ecosystem with direct interface with all major CSDs across APAC 
    div:
     span : Improve Compliance 
     p : to ever-eveolving regulatory requirements across multiple jurisdictions 
  span : Contact Us for More Details
