 div:
  h1 : Accelerate and Streamline Post-Trade Operations with NOVA RPA 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Improve Efficiency 
     p : Proven over 20% reduction in helpdesk queries, RPA makes processing at least 4 times faster than humans. For instance, a process that took two days could be reduced to 30 minutes, as reported by some financial institutions. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Cost Savings 
     p : Robotic Process Automation can generate up to a 67% reduction in the number of full-time equivalent employees needed for the process. It provides scalability as transaction volumes grow without a corresponding increase in costs. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
   div:
    div:
     h4 : Compliance & Risk 
     p : Automated processes ensure that compliance checks are consistently applied, reducing the risk of regulatory breaches and resulting fines. RPA systems can provide detailed logs of all transactions, aiding in audit and compliance
efforts. 
    span : Know More (https://nova.contemi.com/contact-us)
  p : Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is a technology that uses software robots, or "bots," to automate repetitive, rule-based tasks that are typically performed by humans. These bots can interact with digital systems and software in the same way that people do, making them ideal for tasks that involve routine data processing, manipulation, and communication across various systems. 
The financial industry is under increasing pressure to accelerate trade settlement cycles. With global markets pushing toward T+1 or even T+0 settlements, the demand for streamlined, efficient post-trade processes has never been higher. Robotic Process Automation (RPA) plays a pivotal role in helping financial institutions meet these challenges. 
  div:
   h2 : Key Features 
   p : Programmable software bots 
   p : Replicates human activities on structured data 
   p : Automate specific rule-based tasks 
   p : Assigned User ID 
   p : Plugs into applications without the need for complex integrations 
   p : One bot can perform multiple
processes 
  div:
   h2 : Key Benefits 
   div:
    div:
     div:
      h5 : Faster Settlements 
      p : By automating the matching and validation of trade data, the system can expedite the trade settlement process. 
     div:
      h5 : Cost Savings 
      p : Reduce the cost of capital through collateral optimization and flag potentially fraudulent counterparty activities to avoid regulatory interventions and fines. 
     div:
      h5 : Compliance 
      p : Utilising RPA, the system ensures that post-trade processes adhere to regulatory requirements by consistently applying predefined rules and providing detailed audit logs of all automated activities. 
    div:
     div:
      h5 : Efficiency 
      p : Automating repetitive tasks makes the processes faster and allows you to align your workforce to more productive tasks and make the business more efficient. 
     div:
      h5 : Automation 
      p : Automate routine tasks such as data entry, reconciliation, and report generation, reducing errors and freeing up human resources for more strategic activities. 
     div:
      h5 : Accuracy 
      p : Automation minimizes human errors associated with manual data entry and processing, ensuring greater accuracy in post-trade activities such as reconciliation and reporting. 
  div:
   h2 : How RPA Supports Shortening of Settlement Times 
   div:
    div:
     div : Accelerate Trade Validation 
     div : Automate Reconciliation 
     div : Enhance Exception Management 
     div : Streamline Regulatory Reporting 
    div:
     div : Accelerate Trade Validation 
     p : RPA bots can rapidly cross-verify trade details with multiple data sources, ensuring that transactions are accurate and compliant. This speed significantly reduces the time taken for initial trade validation, a critical step in the settlement process. 
     div : Automate Reconciliation 
     p : Matching trade data across various ledgers and systems is often time-consuming. RPA can perform these reconciliations within seconds, highlighting discrepancies for immediate attention and allowing quick resolution. 
     div : Enhance Exception Management 
     p : In cases where trades require manual intervention, RPA can prioritize and flag exceptions, directing them to the appropriate teams for faster resolution without disrupting other processes. 
     div : Streamline Regulatory Reporting 
     p : Preparing and submitting reports to regulatory authorities can be automated to ensure timely and accurate submissions, avoiding compliance-related delays that could impact settlement times. 
  p : In the race to shorten settlement times, RPA is an essential tool that enables financial institutions to modernise their post-trade operations. By automating critical tasks, brokers and clearing houses can reduce settlement times, lower operational risks, and ensure compliance—all while optimizing resources. As the global push for T+1 and T+0 settlement continues, RPA-enabled solutions like NOVA are instrumental in helping firms navigate and thrive in this rapidly evolving landscape.
NOVA’s post-trade automation solution, powered by advanced RPA technology, supports brokers and financial institutions in achieving shorter settlement times. Our platform automates end-to-end post-trade processes, from trade validation and reconciliation to regulatory reporting and exception management. By leveraging RPA, brokers can improve efficiency, accuracy, and scalability, meeting the demands of evolving settlement cycles with confidence.

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : The Buy-Side’s Challenges in Implementing T+1 Settlement 
       div:
        a : May 27, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/05/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Gopala Subramanium (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gopala-subramanium/)
      div:
       a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
       div:
        a : The Run to ZERO: A Deep Dive into Shorter Settlement Cycles (https://nova.contemi.com/the-run-to-zero-a-deep-dive-into-shorter-settlement-cycles/)
        h3 : Introduction 
        span : The T+1 settlement cycle, set to be implemented tomorrow, represents a major shift in the financial markets, reducing the settlement period from two days (T+2) to one day (T+1). This change is intended to streamline processes, reduce counterparty risk, and enhance market liquidity. However, the transition has sparked significant debate and operational challenges, particularly for the buy-side, which includes asset managers and custodians who must adapt quickly to the new timeline. 
        h3 : How asset managers and custodians are addressing the T+1 challenge? 
        h5 : Asset Managers: 
        p : • Vanguard: In preparation for T+1, Vanguard has invested heavily in upgrading its technology infrastructure and operational processes. They have implemented automated trade matching and reconciliation systems to ensure timely settlement and reduce the risk of errors. 
        p : • BlackRock: BlackRock has been actively engaging with custodians and other market participants to streamline communication and coordination around settlement deadlines. They have also been educating their clients about the implications of T+1 and the steps they are taking to ensure a smooth transition. 
        p : • State Street Global Advisors: State Street has been working closely with its custodian bank, State Street Bank and Trust, to align their processes and systems for T+1 settlement. They have also been conducting extensive testing and simulations to identify and address potential issues before the go-live date. 
        h5 : Custodians: 
        p : • BNY Mellon: BNY Mellon has extended its cut-off times for clients to submit CLS-eligible trade instructions, giving them more time to ensure trades are settled through CLS and reducing the need for bilateral settlements. They have also been providing educational resources and support to their clients to help them navigate the T+1 transition. 
        p : • JPMorgan Chase: JPMorgan Chase has been working with clients to optimize their trade flows and settlement processes to meet the T+1 deadline. They have also been investing in technology to automate and streamline their operations, ensuring timely and accurate settlement. 
        p : • Northern Trust: Northern Trust has been proactive in communicating with clients about the T+1 changes and offering customized solutions to address their specific needs. They have also been collaborating with industry groups and regulators to ensure a smooth and coordinated transition to the new settlement cycle. 
        p : These demonstrate the proactive and collaborative approach that many asset managers and custodians are taking to address the challenges of T+1 settlement. 
        h3 : Operational & Strategic Challenges 
        span : As the T+1 implementation looms, the buy-side is grappling with several operational and strategic challenges: 
        p : 1. FX Cut-Off Conundrum: One of the most contentious issues is the foreign exchange (FX) cut-off times. Custodians and settlement systems like CLS (Continuous Linked Settlement) have not aligned their cut-off times with the new T+1 requirements, leading to operational confusion and increased risk for asset managers. The buy-side must now navigate last-minute adjustments to avoid pre-funding trades and managing bilateral settlements, which increase counterparty risk. 
        p : 2. Operational Challenges: Asset managers are facing significant operational adjustments. This includes updating systems, processes, and workflows to meet the shorter settlement cycle. The need for real-time data and faster decision-making processes has put additional strain on buy-side firms, which must balance settlement security with best execution obligations. 
        p : 3. Custodian Deadlines: Custodians have been adjusting their internal cut-off times, but inconsistencies remain. Some custodians have moved their deadlines closer to the CLS cut-off, while others have not, creating a fragmented landscape. This inconsistency complicates the buy-side’s efforts to ensure timely settlements, leading to potential liquidity issues and increased operational risk. 
        p : 4. Risk Management: The reduction in settlement time inherently reduces counterparty risk but also introduces new risks. The need for rapid execution and settlement increases the pressure on trading desks and back-office operations, potentially leading to errors and inefficiencies. 
        h3 : Controversies and Debates 
        span : The transition to T+1 has not been without controversy. Key points of contention include: 
        p : • CLS’s Decision Not to Move Its Cut-Off: CLS’s refusal to adjust its cut-off times has been a significant source of frustration. Asset managers argue that this decision does not consider the operational realities of the buy-side, forcing them to make last-minute adjustments and increasing bilateral settlement risks. 
        p : • Custodian Responses: While some custodians have proactively moved their cut-off times to accommodate the T+1 transition, others have been slower to adapt. This inconsistency has led to a fragmented approach, complicating the buy-side’s settlement processes and increasing operational risk

chunk-1cb4a16f7249d880848db85938b7fbab.content:
adjust its cut-off times has been a significant source of frustration. Asset managers argue that this decision does not consider the operational realities of the buy-side, forcing them to make last-minute adjustments and increasing bilateral settlement risks. 
        p : • Custodian Responses: While some custodians have proactively moved their cut-off times to accommodate the T+1 transition, others have been slower to adapt. This inconsistency has led to a fragmented approach, complicating the buy-side’s settlement processes and increasing operational risk. 
        p : • Impact on Liquidity: The shortened settlement cycle is expected to create a “golden hour” of liquidity, particularly around the close of the U.S. trading day. This concentration of liquidity could lead to increased volatility and wider spreads, impacting trading strategies and execution quality. 
        h3 : Future Implications and Developments 
        span : Looking ahead, the T+1 transition is likely to drive further changes in market infrastructure and practices. Potential future developments include: 
        p : • Technological Advancements: The need for faster, more efficient settlement processes will likely drive investment in technology, including blockchain and other real-time settlement platforms. These technologies could further reduce settlement times and enhance market efficiency. 
        p : • Regulatory Adjustments: Regulators may need to revisit and revise existing frameworks to accommodate the T+1 environment. This includes ensuring that all market participants, including smaller firms, can comply with the new requirements without disproportionate costs or risks. 
        p : • Market Consolidation: The operational and financial pressures of T+1 may drive further consolidation in the asset management industry. Smaller firms may struggle to adapt, leading to mergers and acquisitions as they seek to leverage economies of scale and technological capabilities. 
        h3 : Conclusion 
        span : The transition to T+1 settlement represents a significant milestone in the evolution of financial markets. While the potential benefits of reduced risk and enhanced efficiency are substantial, the buy-side faces considerable challenges in adapting to the new regime. As the industry navigates this transition, collaboration, innovation, and regulatory support will be crucial in ensuring a smooth and successful implementation. The coming months will be critical in assessing the impact of T+1 and determining the path forward for global financial markets. 
        h3 : Thought-Provoking Questions and Suggested Solutions 
        h5:
         span : 1. 
         span : How will smaller asset managers cope with the increased operational demands of T+1? 
        p:
         span : • 
         span : Leverage Technology: Smaller asset managers should invest in technology solutions that automate and streamline settlement processes. Contemi’s WIN, a Wealth Management solution, offers Model B outsourcing of back-office operations, enabling wealth managers to focus on core activities while ensuring efficient settlement. 
        p : • Collaborate with Custodians: Building strong relationships with custodians who offer flexible cut-off times and robust support can help smaller firms manage the operational demands of T+1. 
        p : • Outsource Operations: Consider outsourcing back-office operations to specialized service providers like Contemi’s Nova, a SaaS-based post-trade solution. This can handle the complexities of T+1 settlements, allowing asset managers to concentrate on investment strategies. 
        h5:
         span : 2. 
         span : What role will emerging technologies play in facilitating shorter settlement cycles? 
        p:
         span : • 
         span : Blockchain and Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT): These technologies can provide real-time, transparent, and secure settlement processes, reducing the need for intermediaries and shortening settlement times. Contemi’s Nova is blockchain/DLT ready, ensuring firms are equipped for future advancements. 
        p : • Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning: AI can be used to predict settlement failures, optimize trade matching, and automate compliance processes, enhancing overall efficiency. 
        p : • Cloud Computing: Leveraging cloud infrastructure like AWS can provide scalability and flexibility, enabling firms to quickly adapt to the increased data and processing demands of T+1 settlements. Contemi offers fully capable solutions and managed services in the cloud for both post-trade and wealth management needs. 
        h5:
         span : 3. 
         span : Will other global markets follow the U.S. lead in moving to T+1, or will a fragmented settlement landscape persist? 
        p:
         span : • 
         span : Global Coordination: International regulatory bodies should work together to harmonize settlement cycles across markets, reducing fragmentation and enhancing global market efficiency. 
        p : • Pilot Programs: Implementing T+1 in phases, starting with pilot programs in select markets, can help identify potential issues and refine processes before a full-scale rollout. 
        p : • Market-Specific Adjustments: Recognize that each market has unique characteristics and may require tailored approaches to settlement cycle reduction. Flexibility and adaptability in implementation strategies will be key. 
        span : By addressing these questions and leveraging collaborative efforts, the financial industry can navigate the T+1 transition effectively, paving the way for a more efficient and resilient market ecosystem. 
        i : Citations & References 
        a : U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) (https://www.sec.gov/oiea/investor-alerts-and-bulletins/new-t1-settlement-cycle-what-investors-need-know-investor)

  p : With diminishing broker fee, growing expenses of infrastructure maintenance and associated manpower costs have become a significant cost for businesses. With increasing demands from regulatory bodies and shortening settlement cycles, the processing costs are only going higher. With NOVA Post Trade managed services, businesses can not only aim to reduce their annual processing costs, but also increase their data processing efficiencies, scale up or down anytime, and innovate quickly without the worry of additional in-house setups and hire required talents. 
  div:
   h2 : The Future of Post Trade 
   div:
    div:
     div : Revamping 
     div : Enable 
     div : Change Management 
     div : De-Risking 
    div:
     div : Revamping 
     span : IT infrastructure and internal processes to scale the business or to bring innovation with inhouse capabilities alone is very slow and uneconomical. Managed services allow low-risk experimentation and alternative business models to develop in a cost efficient, less resource-intensive method. 
     div : Enable 
     span : firms to focus their resources on activities that create and deliver value to the business. A few years ago, the focus was on security, today it is equally on performance. Managed services provide a secure platform, enabling businesses to focus on their core expertise. 
     div : Change Management 
     span : Managed services address the growing concern of lack of experienced specialists to execute complex changes and deliver continuous best-in-class service for the long term. They have a natural ability in the areas emerging technologies bringing significant competitive advantage to businesses. 
     div : De-Risking 
     span : The level of security and type of tools available from hosted services surpasses what a typical asset manager or even regional bank or smaller bank can do on their own. Cloud providers work closely with regulatory bodies to ensure compliance. 
  h2 : Our Managed Services Ecosystem 
  div:
   h4 : Clearing & Settlement Ecosystem 
   h4 : Technology & Data Ecosystem

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : Accelerating Migration to Production with RPA in Post-Trade Clearing and Settlement 
       div:
        a : December 3, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/12/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Gaurav Mehta (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gaurav-mehta/)
      div:
       div:
        a : Nova Post Trade (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114)
        a : Accelerating Migration to Production with RPA in Post-Trade Clearing and Settlement (https://soundcloud.com/samyak-jain-947836114/accelerating-migration-to-production-with-rpa-in-post-trade-clearing-and-settlement)
       div:
        p : Post-trade clearing and settlement operations are both critical and complex, serving as the backbone of financial markets globally. As firms modernize their technology stacks, the migration of applications and processes to the production environment has become a significant hurdle. Migration tasks, such as data transfer, workflow replication, and configuration, are often handled manually. This process is not only time-consuming but also prone to human error, which can lead to operational downtime or failed migrations. 
        p : For financial institutions, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) is emerging as a game-changer, enabling smoother, faster, and more accurate transitions to production environments. 
        h3 : Challenges in Migration to Production 
        p : Moving to a production environment in post-trade operations involves multiple challenges: 
        strong : High Stakes: 
        strong : Complex Processes: 
        strong : Time Sensitivity: 
        strong : Manual Dependencies: 
        h3 : How RPA Transforms Migration 
        p : RPA addresses these challenges by automating repetitive, rules-based tasks that are common in migration processes. 
        b : 1. Streamlined Testing and Validation 
        p : RPA bots can automate test scripts, simulate transactions, and validate data integrity during the migration process. This ensures the production environment is thoroughly vetted without requiring manual effort, reducing the likelihood of errors slipping through. Automation eliminates human error in critical tasks like data entry, configuration, and testing. 
        strong : 2. Data Reconciliation 
        p : Post-trade businesses, especially in Asia, deal with large volumes of data that need to be migrated accurately. RPA bots can compare datasets between test and production environments, identify discrepancies, and ensure complete data reconciliation, all in a fraction of the time required for manual checks. It can handle high volumes of tasks, making them ideal for large-scale migrations. 
        strong : 3. Process Mapping and Workflow Automation 
        p : Migration often involves reconfiguring workflows to align with the new production environment. RPA bots can document, replicate, and test workflows automatically, ensuring that business-critical processes remain intact and functional. 
        strong : 4. Regulatory Compliance Checks 
        p : Post-trade environments are heavily regulated. RPA can automatically check compliance criteria, ensuring that all regulatory requirements are met before the system goes live. This proactive compliance reduces the risk of fines or penalties. Also, every action taken by RPA bots is logged, providing a detailed audit trail to comply with regulatory requirements. 
        strong : 5. Faster Cutover Execution 
        p : During the final cutover to production, RPA bots can execute migration scripts, configure systems, and activate processes more quickly and consistently than manual teams. This accelerates the go-live timeline while minimizing risks. RPA accelerates the migration timeline, enabling businesses to move to production faster. 
        strong : 6. 24/7 Execution and Monitoring 
        p : RPA bots work tirelessly around the clock, enabling continuous progress on migration tasks. They can also monitor the production environment post-migration, flagging any issues for rapid resolution. 
        strong : 7. Cost Savings 
        p : By reducing manual workloads, RPA cuts operational costs during migration projects. 
        h3 : The Future of RPA in Post-Trade Operations 
        p : As the post-trade sector continues to evolve, the role of RPA will only grow. Beyond migration, RPA is already being leveraged to streamline day-to-day clearing and settlement processes, improve exception handling, and enhance reporting. By integrating RPA with advanced technologies like AI and machine learning, firms can achieve even greater levels of automation and intelligence. 
        p : Traditionally, migrating a clearing platform to a production environment would involve weeks of manual data validation, workflow testing, and system configurations. By deploying RPA, financial institutions can automate nearly 80% of these tasks, reducing the migration timeline by 40% and achieving error-free execution. Post-migration monitoring bots ensure a seamless transition, allowing the business to focus on optimizing its new production environment. 
        p : Migration to production environments is a critical milestone for post-trade clearing and settlement businesses. By leveraging RPA, financial institutions can overcome the complexities and risks of these transitions, ensuring faster, more accurate, and cost-effective migrations. As the financial industry embraces digital transformation, RPA stands out as a key enabler for operational excellence in post-trade operations. 
        p : If your organization is exploring ways to simplify migration or optimize post-trade processes, now is the time to consider RPA as a strategic tool for transformation. 
        a : info@contemi.com (mailto:info@con

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      h3 : CGS-CIMB Securities Malaysia Leverages Contemi’s Nova Solution To Improve Service Delivery 
      div:
       a : September 21, 2023 (https://nova.contemi.com/2023/09/)
       a : Press Releases (https://nova.contemi.com/category/press-releases/)
       div:
        span : By 
        a : Malaysia (https://nova.contemi.com/author/malaysia/)
     div:
      a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
      div:
       p : CGS-CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd (CCS) has announced a technology upgrade to provide quicker and more reliable solutions for its clients, as it goes live with Nova, post-trade solution by Contemi. 
       p : NOVA is a modular and highly configurable multi-market, -currency, -entity, and -asset class solution. The end-to-end trade confirmation and settlement services across products and countries will enable CCS to reduce the turnaround time and scale the business quickly and effectively. 
       strong : Mr Alan Inn, Deputy CEO of CCS 
       strong : Mr. Gopala Subramanium, CFO and MD of Post Trade at Contemi Solutions 
       strong : About CGS-CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd 
       p : CGS-CIMB Securities Sdn Bhd (CCS) is one of the leading integrated financial service providers in Asia. It is a 75- 25 joint venture between CGS International Holdings Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of China Galaxy Securities Co. Ltd., and CIMB Group Sdn Bhd. 
       p : Through a network of local offices, branches and strategic partners, we have a global presence in over 15 countries, providing a truly Asian perspective. We are well-position as Asia’s leading financial gateway with a core focus on well researched and in-depth analysis on financial products. 
       p : We are a customer-centric firm and focus on value creation for clients, offering a suite of investment and financial solutions for retail and institutional clients. Our businesses include retail broking, institutional equities, derivatives, prime services, equities research, wealth management and online broking. 
       p : Backed by an award-winning research team, we have one of the most comprehensive research coverage of over 800 stocks in the region. Our strong research capabilities from the backbone of our product and service offerings, connecting clients to opportunities. 
     span : Share

     a : Cancel reply (/cgs-cimb-securities-malaysia-leverages-contemis-nova-solution-to-improve-service-delivery/#respond)

        p : Digital assets have become an integral part of the modern economy, shaping how businesses, financial institutions, and individuals interact with value and ownership. From cryptocurrencies to tokenized assets, digital assets are playing an important role in reshaping the financial landscape, particularly in post-trade processes. 
        h3 : What are Digital Assets? 
        p : Digital assets refer to any asset that exists in digital form and includes the right to use. These assets span across various forms, including digital documents, media, and blockchain-based tokens. The advent of blockchain has expanded the scope of digital assets to include cryptocurrencies and tokenized representations of physical assets. 
        h3 : Types of Digital Assets: 
        ol:
         strong : Backed digital assets: 
         li:
          strong : Native digital assets: 
          ul:
           strong : Centralized digital assets: 
           strong : Decentralized digital assets: 
        h3 : The Role and Opportunities for Digital Assets in the Financial Industry 
        p : Digital assets are increasingly important in the financial sector, particularly in streamlining post-trade processes — clearing, settlement, and custody. Traditionally, these processes have been labour-intensive, requiring significant manual intervention and reconciliation across multiple parties. Digital assets and blockchain technology are changing that. 
        ol:
         strong : Efficiency and automation: 
         strong : Transparency and security: 
         strong : Global accessibility: 
         strong : Risk management: 
         strong : Improve accessibility: 
        h3 : Challenges and Regulatory Considerations 
        p : Despite their potential, digital assets face regulatory uncertainty. Fragmented legal frameworks across different jurisdictions can complicate cross-border transactions. Additionally, ensuring consumer protection, preventing financial crimes, and maintaining market stability are ongoing concerns that regulators are addressing as the digital asset landscape evolves. 
        h3 : Conclusion 
        p : Digital assets are revolutionizing the financial industry by improving efficiency, transparency, and accessibility, especially in post-trade processes. As regulatory frameworks catch up, digital assets will continue to unlock new opportunities, simplifying complex transactions and reducing costs, all while fostering innovation across the financial sector. 
        p : The experts’ view that a decentralized approach allows a company to stay relevant is particularly important. As digital assets and DLT offer new business opportunities for businesses, staying adaptable and open to new forms of collaboration is essential. Although measuring the exact costs of decentralized versus centralized approaches is challenging, the potential for innovation and relevance in the market can provide significant competitive advantages.

chunk-389664f8d4bfb9be0328be8794edc002.content:
span : Blogs (https://nova.contemi.com/blogs/)

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : The Run to ZERO: A Deep Dive into Shorter Settlement Cycles 
       div:
        a : March 13, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/03/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Gopala Subramanium (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gopala-subramanium/)
      div:
       a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
       div:
        h2 : Pretext: 
        p : The architecture of financial markets is fundamentally dependent on the efficiency and timing of its settlement cycles—the process that completes transactions through the exchange of securities and cash post-trade execution. Historically, these cycles ranged from a few days to longer, with a move from T+3 to T+2 being a significant shift in markets like the US. However, with the advent of technological advancements and changes in market participants’ expectations, there’s a pressing momentum towards even shorter cycles, namely T+0 or instant settlement. This article springs from the recent deliberations by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to introduce such innovative settlement cycles on an optional basis in Indian markets. It critically explores the evolution of settlement cycles, their current state, and the motivations behind this shift. Furthermore, it delves into the potential benefits and challenges of moving towards T+0 and instant settlement, considering the Indian market’s unique context, including its recent embrace of T+1 settlement, the robustness of its payment and banking systems, and the growing demand for operational efficiency and investor satisfaction. 
        h2 : Introduction 
        p : The settlement cycle plays a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth functioning and stability of financial markets. It guarantees that the exchange of securities and cash occurs efficiently, mitigating counterparty risk and fostering market confidence. However, in a rapidly evolving financial ecosystem characterized by high-frequency trading and technological advancements, the traditional T+2 or longer cycles appear increasingly antiquated. Proponents of T+0 argue that it offers numerous advantages, including increased market efficiency, reduced systemic risk, and the potential for unlocking new investment opportunities. 
        h3 : Understanding Settlement Cycles 
        p : To grasp the significance of T+0, it’s crucial to understand the current state of settlement cycles. Let’s break it down: 
        ul:
         strong : T (Trade Date) 
         strong : Settlement Date 
         strong : T+2 
         strong : T+0 
        h3 : Current Settlement Cycles: 
        p : Across the globe, settlement cycles vary, with a mix of T+2, T+3, and even T+5 models persisting: 
        ul:
         strong : US 
         strong : UK 
         strong : Europe 
         strong : Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia 
         strong : New Zealand 
         strong : India 
        h3 : The Impetus for Change 
        p : Several factors are driving the push towards T+0 settlement: 
        ul:
         b : Technological advancements 
         b : Reduced counterparty risk 
         b : Improved market efficiency 
         b : Increased liquidity 
         b : Potential for new products 
        h3 : Impact on Stakeholders 
        p : Shifting to T+0 would undoubtedly impact various stakeholders: 
        ul:
         li:
          b : Investors 
          span : : Faster settlement could benefit investors through reduced risk exposure and potentially, improved return opportunities. 
         b : Issuers 
         b : Market infrastructure providers 
         b : Regulators 
        h3 : Advantages of Moving to T+0 
        p : While not without its challenges, T+0 offers several potential advantages: 
        ul:
         b : Reduced counterparty risk 
         b : Enhanced market efficiency 
         b : Improved liquidity 
         b : Potential for new financial products 
        h3 : Challenges and Considerations 
        p : Despite its potential benefits, transitioning to T+0 presents several challenges: 
        ul:
         b : Technological infrastructure 
         b : Operational complexities 
         b : Legal and regulatory considerations 
         b : Cybersecurity risks 
        h3 : The Path to Implementation 
        p : Moving to T+0 requires a collaborative and phased approach: 
        ul:
         b : Industry-wide dialogue 
         b : Cost-benefit analysis 
         b : Pilot programs 
         b : Phased implementation 
        h3 : Future Perspectives 
        p : The push towards T+0 reflects a broader trend towards faster, more efficient, and technologically driven financial markets. While significant challenges exist, the potential benefits of T+0 are undeniable. Continued advancements in technology, collaboration among stakeholders, and a well-defined implementation strategy will be crucial in facilitating a smooth transition to a T+0 settlement environment. 
        h3 : Critically Examining the Rush Towards T+0: A False Hope? 
        p : The push towards T+0 settlement is not without its critics who question whether it represents a genuine advancement or a solution in search of a problem. Let’s delve deeper into this critical perspective. 
        h4 : Are We Overlooking Existing Solutions? 
        p : Advocates of T+0 often highlight the benefits of reduced counterparty risk and improved efficiency. However, some argue that these goals can be achieved through alternative means. 
        ul:
         b : Margin requirements 
         b : Collateral management 
         b : Settlement discipline 
        h4 : The “If

chunk-04cfc316b9870adb9587f01dda971e7d.content:
a genuine advancement or a solution in search of a problem. Let’s delve deeper into this critical perspective. 
        h4 : Are We Overlooking Existing Solutions? 
        p : Advocates of T+0 often highlight the benefits of reduced counterparty risk and improved efficiency. However, some argue that these goals can be achieved through alternative means. 
        ul:
         b : Margin requirements 
         b : Collateral management 
         b : Settlement discipline 
        h4 : The “If It Ain’t Broke, Don’t Fix It” Argument: 
        p : Proponents of the status quo argue that current settlement cycles, especially T+2, function adequately in most markets. They question the need to disrupt established processes for potential benefits that may not outweigh the significant costs and challenges associated with T+0 transition. 
        h4 : Are We Chasing an Illusion? 
        p : Some argue that the advantages of T+0 might be overstated. The potential for increased market volatility due to faster price adjustments and potential for manipulative trading strategies cannot be ignored. Additionally, the efficiency gains might not be as significant as projected, especially considering the operational complexities T+0 introduces. 
        h4 : The Case of India’s T+0 Consultation Paper: 
        p : The recent consultation paper released by SEBI on December 22nd, 2023, proposing optional T+0 and instant settlements alongside the existing T+1 cycle in India exemplifies the cautious approach some authorities are taking. This approach acknowledges the potential benefits of T+0 while recognizing the need for a measured exploration alongside existing settlement options. 
        h4 : A Call for Balanced Evaluation: 
        p : The transition to T+0 is a complex and multifaceted issue. While the potential benefits are undeniable, a critical examination of its necessity and potential pitfalls is crucial. A balanced approach that explores alternative solutions alongside T+0 remains essential. Ultimately, the goal should be to achieve a settlement framework that optimizes efficiency, risk management, and market stability. 
        h3 : Conclusion: 
        p : The transition to T+0 represents a significant shift in the settlement landscape. While it presents challenges, the potential benefits for market efficiency, risk reduction, and innovation are substantial. Careful consideration, collaborative efforts, and a well-structured implementation plan are necessary to harness the full potential of T+0, paving the way for a more robust and efficient financial ecosystem for the future.

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : Automating Fractional Trading: Empowering Malaysia’s Steps to Financial Inclusion 
       div:
        a : May 8, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/05/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Kenneth Lim (https://nova.contemi.com/author/kenneth-lim/)
      div:
       a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
       div:
        p : In September 2023, The Securities Commission of Malaysia (SC) announced the regulations that would allow stockbroking companies to offer fractional share trading services for shares listed on Bursa Malaysia. This remarkable initiative democratizes investment opportunities for a broader segment of society. 
        p : In the rapidly evolving landscape of financial markets, particularly in Malaysia, the adoption of innovative technologies is reshaping traditional practices for stockbrokers. Automation streamlines the entire fractional trading process, from order placement to execution and settlement. This efficiency reduces manual intervention, minimizes errors, and accelerates transaction times. Stockbrokers can leverage algorithmic trading systems to facilitate seamless fractional trades, enabling them to efficiently handle larger volumes of transactions. This shift allows brokerage firms to focus on providing value-added services such as personalized investment advice and portfolio management, enhancing overall client experience. 
        p : NOVA Post Trade automation solution offers a cutting-edge Fractional Trading module that brings a range of powerful features designed to enhance trading capabilities and open new opportunities for investors in the Malaysian market. 
        strong : Support for Trading Odd Lot and Fractional Quantities 
        p : Feature: Investors can trade in odd lot quantities and fractional quantities, enabling them to participate in the market with greater flexibility. 
        p : Benefit: This feature allows investors to optimize their trading strategies by executing transactions in smaller increments, facilitating smoother portfolio management. 
        strong : Customizable Decimal Places at Instrument Level 
        p : Feature: NOVA Post Trade allows the configuration of several decimal places at the instrument level, providing precision tailored to each financial instrument. 
        p : Benefit: Customizable decimal places ensure accuracy in trading calculations, enhancing transparency, and reducing the risk of errors. 
        strong : Client-Specific Fractional Trading Restrictions 
        p : Feature: Fractional Trading can be restricted to specific clients based on predefined criteria, offering control and customization to broker firms. 
        p : Benefit: This feature enables broker firms to tailor their services to different client segments, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and business preferences. 
        strong : Handling Corporate Action Entitlements for Fractional Trades 
        p : Feature: NOVA Post Trade seamlessly handles corporate action entitlements for fractional trades, ensuring that investors receive their fair share of dividends and other corporate benefits. 
        p : Benefit: Investors can confidently participate in fractional trading knowing that their entitlements will be accurately calculated and distributed. 
        strong : Automate the migration process for Fractional Instruments 
        p : Feature: The platform provides a streamlined migration process to automatically create fractional instruments in the market, simplifying the transition for market participants. 
        p : Benefit: This automation minimizes manual effort and reduces the risk of errors during the migration process, ensuring a smooth transition to fractional trading. 
        strong : Separate Instrument Support for Fractional Trading 
        p : Feature: Fractional trading is supported in separate instruments distinct from market trading, providing clarity and organization in the trading process. 
        p : Benefit: Clear separation ensures transparency and simplifies trade execution, reducing confusion and enhancing user experience. 
        strong : Flexible Cash Settlement options 
        p : Feature: While client cash settlement is expected through client trust accounts, NOVA Post Trade can be configured to support alternative payment methods, offering flexibility to market participants. 
        p : Benefit: Flexibility in cash settlement options accommodates diverse investor preferences and operational requirements, enhancing overall user satisfaction. 
        strong : Market Trading Through Principal Account 
        p : Feature: Market trading is facilitated through principal accounts in market instruments, ensuring smooth execution of trades. 
        p : Benefit: This feature simplifies the trading process and provides a seamless experience for investors, improving operational efficiency. 
        strong : Auto Settlement of Trades As per Market’s Norm 
        p : Feature: Trades settle as per market norms, with stocks flagged for auto-settlement on the due date, ensuring timely and accurate transaction processing. 
        p : Benefit: Automated settlement processes reduce manual intervention and minimize settlement risks, enhancing overall trading efficiency and reliability. 
        strong : Regulatory Compliance with Separate Principal Accounts 
        p : Feature: NOVA Post Trade supports the creation of separate principal accounts based on regulatory requirements. 
        p : Benefit: Compliance with regulatory requirements is streamlined, ensuring adherence to local regulations and promoting trust and transparency in the market. 
        p : By leveraging technology to enhance accessibility, efficiency, and risk management, brokerage firms can unlock new growth avenues while fostering financial inclusion and market democratization.

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : Enhancing Post-Trade Management with NOVA: A Comprehensive Solution for Institutional and Retail Brokers 
       div:
        a : November 14, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/11/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Nova Post Trade+ (https://nova.contemi.com/author/nova-post-trade/)
      div:
       span : Managing post-trade processes efficiently is essential for both institutional and retail brokers. NOVA, a powerful post-trade solution, streamlines complex workflows, improves operational efficiency, and enhances regulatory compliance, empowering brokers to cut costs and deliver a better client experience. 
       span : Post-Trade Processing for Institutional Brokers 
       span : Institutional brokers handle high trade volumes across multiple asset classes, which requires a system that’s accurate, scalable, and efficient. NOVA offers a complete, multi-asset post-trade solution with features like Straight-Through Processing (STP), real-time exception management, and full trade lifecycle coverage—from trade capture to settlement. 
       p:
        span : By supporting core functions like accounting, position management, risk assessment, and reconciliation, NOVA provides 
        a:
         b : institutional brokers (https://nova.contemi.com/institutional-broker-post-trade-management/)
         span : post trade management (https://nova.contemi.com/institutional-broker-post-trade-management/)
        span : with a reliable post-trade infrastructure. It also includes robust reporting tools for client statements, regulatory filings, and internal documentation, making compliance easier. 
       span : Key Features for Institutional Brokers: 
       ul:
        span : Operational Efficiency: Automated STP reduces manual work, cutting down errors and speeding up processes. 
        span : Cost Savings: Cloud-based infrastructure lowers costs compared to traditional on-premise systems. 
        span : Scalability: NOVA’s multi-tier architecture grows with your business, handling increased trade volumes effortlessly. 
        span : Security: Multi-layer encryption safeguards sensitive data against security risks. 
        span : Clearing & Settlement: Integrates directly with major Central Securities Depositories (CSDs) in key regions. 
       span : Regulatory Compliance: Adapts to changing regulations across jurisdictions to keep you compliant. 
       span : Post-Trade Processing for Retail Brokers 
       p:
        span : For 
        a:
         b : retail brokers (https://nova.contemi.com/retail-broker-post-trade-management/)
         span : post trade management (https://nova.contemi.com/retail-broker-post-trade-management/)
        span : , keeping costs low and staying compliant are critical. NOVA offers a simplified post-trade solution tailored to these needs, with features that improve client satisfaction as well. Its multi-tier architecture supports global compliance standards, diverse messaging formats, and multiple asset classes, giving retail brokers the tools to grow their market reach. 
       span : NOVA also focuses on client empowerment, providing brokers with instant access to end-client data and offering clients self-service tools. This means retail brokers can give their clients more control and flexibility while maintaining operational efficiency. 
       span : Key Features for Retail Brokers: 
       ul:
        span : Compliance & Transparency: Ensures alignment with global regulations, supporting secure and compliant post-trade operations. 
        span : Client Empowerment: Self-service tools enable clients to manage their portfolios, enhancing their experience. 
        span : Operational Efficiency: Automation reduces manual errors, cuts costs, and boosts accuracy in the post-trade lifecycle. 
        span : Data Security: A multi-layered architecture protects sensitive information, ensuring data privacy. 
        span : Scalability: NOVA’s future-ready infrastructure grows with your firm, making expansion easy. 
       span : NOVA’s Managed Services 
       span : Managing post-trade operations in-house can be resource-intensive. NOVA’s managed services provide a cloud-hosted, scalable solution that simplifies post-trade processes and reduces the need for internal resources. This allows brokers to focus on growth while NOVA handles the operational heavy lifting. 
       span : Benefits of Managed Services: 
       ul:
        span : Lower Operational Costs: Cloud hosting minimizes the expense of in-house infrastructure and maintenance. 
        span : Improved Efficiency: Automation cuts down on manual tasks, reducing errors and speeding up processing. 
        span : Enhanced Security: Multi-tier encryption keeps data secure, meeting the highest security standards. 
        span : Regulatory Compliance: Real-time reporting and compliance tools help you stay on top of regulatory changes effortlessly. 
       span : Elevate Your Post-Trade Operations with NOVA 
       span : NOVA is built to support both institutional and retail brokers in managing post-trade processes efficiently and securely. Whether you’re handling high trade volumes or aiming to optimize operations as your client base grows, NOVA provides the tools to cut costs, ensure compliance, and boost overall efficiency. 
       span : Choosing NOVA gives brokers a comprehensive solution to tackle the challenges of post-trade management, positioning them to succeed in today’s competitive financial landscape. 
       span : FAQs 
       b : What sets NOVA apart from other post-trade solutions? 
       span : NOVA is built for both institutional and retail brokers, offering a cloud-hosted, scalable architecture with automated processing, real-time reporting, and compliance tools. It’s designed to deliver efficiency and flexibility, adapting to evolving regulations across multiple jurisdictions. 
       b : How does NOVA help with regulatory compliance?

       h3 : Malaysia’s E-Invoicing Mandate Promises Enhanced Efficiency & Inclusivity to Stockbrokers In The Country 
       div:
        a : April 8, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/04/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Kenneth Lim (https://nova.contemi.com/author/kenneth-lim/)
      div:
       a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
       div:
        p : Governments worldwide are increasingly embracing electronic solutions to streamline processes and enhance efficiency across various sectors. Malaysia, a fast-growing economy in Southeast Asia. It has recently introduced a significant initiative – the e invoicing mandate. This mandate aims to modernize the country’s invoicing system. Transitioning from traditional paper-based processes to electronic formats. While the benefits of e invoicing are evident in terms of efficiency and cost savings. Its impact on capital markets is a topic of considerable interest and discussion. 
        p : The Government of Malaysia will implement e-invoices in stages to enhance the efficiency of Malaysia’s tax administration management. The Inland Revenue Board Malaysia (IRBM), also known as Lembaga Hasil Dalam Negeri (LHDN), announced that the e invoicing initiative will be implemented in phases beginning in August 2024. This mandate applies to businesses with an annual turnover exceeding RM 100 Mn+ in the first phase. With the next phase, applicable to businesses with an annual turnover of over RM 25 Mn+ by January 2025. The final stage to go live by July 2025 will effectively cover a significant portion of the commercial landscape in the country. 
        p : Under the mandate, businesses are required to generate and transmit electronic invoices in a standardized format. Which is known as the Malaysian Revenue Accounting System (MYS) XML. This format ensures uniformity and compatibility across different systems, facilitating seamless exchange of invoices between buyers and suppliers. 
        h2 : How does e-invoicing impact stockbrokers in Malaysia? 
        p : The implementation of e invoicing in Malaysia is expected to have several implications for the stockbrokers: 
        strong : Improved Transparency and Data Accessibility: 
        p : E invoicing will promote transparency in financial transactions. By providing a digital trail of invoices and payment records. This transparency will enhance the reliability of financial information. Making it easier for investors and stakeholders to assess the financial health and performance of companies. With easier access to accurate data. Investors can make more informed decisions, leading to greater confidence in capital markets. 
        strong : Enhanced Efficiency and Cost Reduction: 
        p : The automation of invoicing processes through e invoicing will result in significant cost savings for businesses. By eliminating paper-based documentation and manual processing.  Companies can reduce administrative expenses and improve operational efficiency. This increased efficiency can translate into higher profitability for businesses, thereby potentially attracting more investment in capital markets. 
        strong : Strengthening Regulatory Compliance: 
        p : The e invoicing mandate imposes strict compliance requirements on businesses. Including the use of standardized formats and adherence to data integrity standards. This focus on regulatory compliance is likely to instill greater confidence among investors, as it signifies a commitment to maintaining integrity and transparency in financial operations. Consequently, compliant businesses may enjoy enhanced credibility and reputation in capital markets, potentially attracting more investment. 
        strong : Facilitating Access to Financing: 
        p : E invoicing can simplify the documentation and verification processes involved in financing arrangements such as invoice financing and supply chain financing. With electronic invoices readily available in standardized formats, lenders can assess the creditworthiness of businesses more efficiently, enabling quicker approval of financing facilities. This streamlined process enhances access to capital for businesses, fostering growth and expansion opportunities that contribute to the vibrancy of capital markets. 
        h2 : Overcoming concerns and challenges with the NOVA E-Invoicing module 
        p:
         strong : Cost of Technology | 
         a : NOVA E Invoicing module (https://nova.contemi.com/e-invoicing/)
        p:
         strong : Integration with existing systems | 
         a : NOVA E Invoicing (https://nova.contemi.com/e-invoicing/)
        p:
         strong : Cybersecurity | 
         a : NOVA (https://contemi.com/)
        p:
         a : e invoicing (https://nova.contemi.com/e-invoicing/)

       h3 : A Look at Leaders in Post-Trade Automation 
       div:
        a : November 14, 2024 (https://nova.contemi.com/2024/11/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Nova Post Trade+ (https://nova.contemi.com/author/nova-post-trade/)
      div:
       p:
        span : Success among brokers and financial institutions depends critically on effective post-trade management in the fast-paced financial scene of today. To meet changing market needs, both institutional and retail brokers are aggressively looking for methods to increase the accuracy, speed, and efficiency of their post-trade 
        span : services 
        span : . This has brought post-trade automation—a crucial field experiencing notable innovation and expansion—front stage. Leading this change is Nova Post Trade, a solution meant to maximize and automate post-trade procedures for financial institutions and brokers both. 
       a : Post Trade Management (https://nova.contemi.com/)
       a : Post trade management (https://nova.contemi.com/)
       a : Post-Trade Automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       a : Post-trade automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       a : Post-Trade Automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       span : Automating post-trade processes with solutions like Nova Post Trade brings significant advantages for brokers: 
       ul:
        li:
         b : Operational Efficiency 
         span : : By reducing the need for manual intervention, Nova Post Trade enables brokers to process trades quickly and efficiently, allowing them to handle higher trade volumes without scaling up their workforce. 
        li:
         b : Reduced Error Rates 
         span : : Automation minimizes human errors, which can be costly and time-consuming to resolve. With Nova Post Trade, brokers can rely on accurate trade processing and seamless reconciliation. 
        li:
         b : Enhanced Compliance 
         span : : Nova Post Trade is designed to adhere to global regulatory standards, ensuring that all post-trade activities comply with the latest rules and regulations. 
        li:
         b : Cost Savings 
         span : : By automating labor-intensive processes, brokers save on operational costs and allocate resources to more strategic, revenue-generating activities. 
        li:
         b : Improved Client Experience 
         span : : Faster, more reliable trade processing enhances the overall client experience, an essential factor in maintaining long-term client relationships. 
       a : Post-Trade Automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       span : Specifically designed to satisfy the demands of institutional and retail brokers, Nova Post Trade provides a comprehensive post-trade management solution that accurately and quickly handles the entire post-trade management lifecycle by incorporating cutting-edge technology and automation into its platform. 
       span : Streamlined Trade Matching and Confirmation 
       span : The time it takes to verify and finish trades is greatly decreased by Nova Post Trade, which gives brokers automated tools to handle trade matching and confirmation duties. Brokers can more quickly and accurately reconcile trades thanks to this feature, which guarantees that any discrepancies are quickly resolved. 
       span : Automated Reconciliation and Settlement 
       span : An essential part of post-trade management is settlement and reconciliation, which Nova Post Trade is very good at automating. All trades are completed and settled precisely thanks to the platform’s automated reconciliation tool, which swiftly finds and fixes disparities in trade data. Brokers lower the possibility of delays and enhance their overall cash flow management by automating settlement procedures. 
       span : Real-Time Reporting and Analytics 
       span : One of Nova Post Trade’s standout features is its real-time reporting and analytics capabilities. With the help of this feature, brokers can learn more about their trading activity, increasing transparency and facilitating better decision-making. With access to up-to-the-minute data, brokers can identify trends, assess risks, and respond proactively to changes in the market. 
       a : Post-Trade Automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       span : Solutions like Nova Post Trade are leading the way in the post-trade automation revolution that brokers and financial institutions are continuing to implement. To promote ongoing advancements in post-trade administration, Nova Post Trade makes use of cutting-edge technologies like cloud-based architecture, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. 
       span : Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning 
       span : Nova Post Trade, which uses AI-driven algorithms to identify patterns, detect anomalies, and optimize workflows, is transforming post-trade automation by allowing systems to learn from data and make decisions without manual intervention. For brokers, this means improved trade reconciliation accuracy, as well as faster identification and resolution of potential issues. 
       span : Blockchain and Distributed Ledger Technology 
       span : By providing a safe, distributed means of tracking and settling transactions, blockchain technology might upend post-trade administration. Nova Post Trade is looking at methods to include blockchain into its offering so that brokers may quickly and transparently check transactions. Over all post-trade procedures, this technology might lower settlement times, save costs, and increase security. 
       span : Cloud-Based Scalability 
       span : The requirement for scalable post-trade solutions rises with transaction volumes. The cloud-based architecture of Nova Post Trade lets brokers easily grow their activities, therefore assuring they can manage rising volumes and meet changing market needs without sacrificing performance. Cloud technology also improves data security, therefore

chunk-3f297e50b80b416e329ea9fcd21ad458.content:
blockchain into its offering so that brokers may quickly and transparently check transactions. Over all post-trade procedures, this technology might lower settlement times, save costs, and increase security. 
       span : Cloud-Based Scalability 
       span : The requirement for scalable post-trade solutions rises with transaction volumes. The cloud-based architecture of Nova Post Trade lets brokers easily grow their activities, therefore assuring they can manage rising volumes and meet changing market needs without sacrificing performance. Cloud technology also improves data security, therefore guaranteeing that private trade data stays under protection. 
       a : Post-Trade Automation (https://nova.contemi.com/automated-post-trade-solutions/)
       span : Automating post-trade procedures is now a must for brokers trying to remain competitive rather than a choice. Providing automation that improves productivity, compliance, and customer happiness, Nova Post Trade presents a strong answer catered to the particular demands of institutional and retail brokers. Investing in Nova Post Trade helps brokers future-proof their operations, lower running costs, and react quickly to a market growingly complicated and regulated. 
       span : Nova Post Trade helps brokers to maximize their processes, lower risks, and keep a competitive edge by means of its complete post-trade administration tools. Leading the way as the financial services sector adopts automation is Nova Post Trade, which helps brokers to attain more dependability and efficiency in their post-trade activities. 
       span : Conclusion: The Road Ahead for Nova Post Trade and Post-Trade Automation 
       span : With automation bringing revolutionary changes in broker post-trade operations, post-trade management has bright future prospects. Leading this change is Nova Post Trade, which provides creative ideas allowing brokers to manage trades with unparalleled accuracy, compliance, and speed. Working with Nova Post Trade helps brokers present themselves as leaders in the changing financial scene ready to satisfy both their clients and authorities. 
       span : Nova Post Trade will keep using cutting-edge technology to improve its products as the financial sector develops, giving brokers a strong, scalable, future-proof post-trade management solution. Accepting Nova Post Trade means accepting a future of improved client service, low cost, and efficiency. 
       span : FAQs 
       b : What is post-trade management? 
       span : Post-trade management encompasses all the processes that occur after a trade is executed, including confirmation, reconciliation, settlement, and reporting. It ensures that trades are accurately completed and settled in compliance with regulatory standards. 
       b : How does post-trade automation benefit brokers? 
       span : Post-trade automation reduces errors, enhances efficiency, ensures compliance, and cuts down operational costs, allowing brokers to manage a higher volume of trades with minimal manual intervention. 
       b : What technologies does Nova Post Trade use in post-trade automation? 
       span : Nova Post Trade uses technologies like AI, machine learning, blockchain, and cloud computing to streamline post-trade processes, making them faster, more secure, and highly scalable. 
       b : How does real-time reporting benefit brokers? 
       span : Real-time reporting gives brokers access to up-to-date insights on trade activity, allowing them to make informed decisions, track market trends, and respond proactively to risks or opportunities. 
       b : What role does blockchain play in post-trade automation? 
       span : Blockchain can provide a secure, decentralized method for verifying and settling trades, reducing settlement times and costs, while improving transparency and security. 
       b : Why is Nova Post Trade considered a leader in post-trade automation? 
       span : Nova Post Trade offers a comprehensive solution tailored to the needs of brokers, providing automation for trade confirmation, reconciliation, and reporting. Its innovative approach and use of advanced technologies make it a top choice for brokers seeking efficiency and reliability.

 div:
  h3 : Nova Post Trade 
  div:
   div:
    div:
     div:
      div:
       h3 : Fractional Trading: Malaysia’s Exciting Step Forward In Investing 
       div:
        a : August 25, 2023 (https://nova.contemi.com/2023/08/)
        a : Articles (https://nova.contemi.com/category/articles/)
        div:
         span : By 
         a : Gopala Subramanium (https://nova.contemi.com/author/gopala-subramanium/)
      div:
       a : Trinity Audio (//trinityaudio.ai)
       div:
        p : The end of 2023 will mark a pivotal moment in Malaysia’s stock market, with the government’s recent announcement to unveil fractional trading. The honourable Prime Minister and Minister of Finance, Dato’ Seri Anwar bin Ibrahim, announced on July 27th, 2023, that his government will allow trading of smaller share lots and fractional shares making investments affordable. “There will be more retail investors out there who can afford to buy shares…and I believe this will boost the Malaysian capital market,” said Deputy Finance Minister Datuk Seri Ahmad Maslan at a press conference at the Bursa Marketplace Fair 2023 on August 5th. 
        p : This breakthrough development has the potential to revolutionize the market, making it more accessible and efficient for retail investors, thereby fostering increased liquidity, confidence, and economic progress. 
        h3 : UNDERSTANDING FRACTIONAL TRADING? 
        p : Fractional trading is a transformative approach that allows investors to buy or sell company shares in smaller denominations than the conventional board lot size. This initiative will make retail investors’ access to blue chip stocks easier. Now, even the shares of top-tier companies like AirAsia or Petronas become accessible without demanding a hefty investment. 
        h4 : BENEFITS TO INVESTORS 
        ul:
         strong : Affordability: 
         strong : Diversification: 
         strong : Flexibility: 
        h4 : THE POSITIVE IMPACT ON MARKETS 
        ul:
         strong : Liquidity Boost: 
         strong : New Investor Attraction: 
         strong : Accessibility: 
        h3 : A GLIMPSE AT HISTORICAL PRECEDENTS 
        p : The concept of fractional trading isn’t entirely new and has proven successful in various countries such as the United States, Canada, Australia, the United Kingdom, and Singapore. Wherever the concept is implemented, it has simplified investment initiation, diversified investment opportunities, and fostered liquidity and fair pricing. 
        h3 : POSSIBLE RISKS, CHALLENGES & MITIGATION 
        table:
         tr:
          th : Risks, Challenges 
          th : Mitigation 
         tbody:
          tr:
           th : Liquidity 
           td : Potential difficulty in finding fractional share buyers and sellers. 
           td : Encouraging more stock listings. 
          tr:
           th : Pricing 
           td : The lack of a standard pricing method for fractional shares. 
           td : Development of a standardized pricing approach. 
          tr:
           th : Regulation 
           td : Legal framework adaptation to accommodate fractional trading. 
           td : Collaborative regulation development with the stock exchange. 
          tr:
           th : Technology 
           td : Technology Need for settlement systems for fractional trades. 
           td : Partnerships with tech companies. 
          tr:
           th : Customer Awareness 
           td : Need for investor education and promotion. 
           td : Educational content creation and marketing campaigns. 
        h3 : GOVERNMENT’S PARTICIPATION 
        p : Fractional trading represents an inspiring and optimistic change for Bursa Malaysia, laying the groundwork for an invigorated financial landscape. It’s a significant step, but there’s also an exciting opportunity for the government to take further action. By enhancing the profitability of listed companies and elevating the overall transparency and efficiency of the market, we can look forward to a thriving investment climate in Malaysia. Together with comprehensive strategies like support incentives, the country is poised to cultivate sustainable, long-term investment opportunities that benefit all. 
        h3 : CONCLUSION 
        p : Fractional trading marks a promising horizon for the Malaysian capital market, paving the way for more inclusive and affordable retail investing. But a holistic approach, focusing on overall market health, is vital. 
        p : A well-designed post-trade settlement solution like Nova+, already successful in Singapore market, can be the catalyst for smooth fractional trading. Contemi’s innovative solutions like Nova+ reiterate its unwavering commitment to nurturing capital markets.
